If you're here in Vegas for a convention or on vacation and looking for something delicious and different... Pho Thanh Huong is right down the street from the Strip. Go to this restaurant... You will love it!

Thought about giving it 4 stars only to show respect for Boston's Pho Pastuer... But everything was great.. So 5 stars it is. $8.50 pho, great service, free eggroll with yelp check-in coupon.  perfect!  We will be back next time in Las Vegas.  If you like pho... This will not disappoint.

alright i know that vietnamese service usually sucks... but... they really sucked. they wrote down the wrong order and forgot our drink orders... it was so hard to get their attention too!

the food was relatively good... but for las vegas standards. i'm from san jose so it's kind of biased to compare.

i would go back again, just order togo or something!

We came here for simple dinner to get away from eating Vegas Strip food. Michelle and I shared a bowl of Pho,  the Lemongrass Chicken and Vietnamese egg rolls.  Restaurant looks clean, simply decorated and has a TV which was playing with no volume. Food came out fast and was very good. Pho came with the usual accompaniments...bean sprouts, jalapeños etc.
Prices are very reasonable, service was excellent and the staff was pleasant as well as attentive.
We will be back in future Vegas trips

Of the four Vietnamese restaurants I've tried in Las Vegas and Henderson, this is the best. And it's because of the pho -- the reason I visit any Vietnamese place.

Although I prefer veggie broth, I'll admit that the pork broth used here for nearly every type of pho is tastier. Just not healthier. The soup has come out remarkably quickly during a couple of my visits, which is helpful when I'm pressed for time because pho isn't exactly a dine-and-dash experience. 

The quality of the sliced chicken is the highest of any pho place I've visited in Nevada; when I got a bowl recently at a pho place in Northern Nevada that I also rated four stars, there was no comparison. That place rates highly amid the dearth of good ethnic food in Northern Nevada, while this place rates highly in a foodie's paradise.

If I have one quibble with the aforementioned foodie's paradise, it's that some Las Vegas-area restaurants play current popular music a bit too loud in what appears to be a sad bid for hipness cred. It's annoying and diminishes my enjoyment of my meal. Fortunately, this place is nice and quiet. There's music playing and a TV on, but neither interferes with my enjoyment of my meal.

A word to the wise: I showed up about 9:20 p.m. recently, 40 minutes before the restaurant closes, and I was seated. People who showed up after maybe 9:30 p.m. weren't; they were told they could only order food to go. 

The only real negative I can see about this place is its location, in a not-so-nice strip mall. I realize that "not-so-nice strip mall" might seem redundant, but even by strip malls' middling standards, this one looks kinda dirty. Once you're inside, of course, that's not a concern.

I love this place very convenient for students in Unlv!!! Love their variety of Pho!! 
I am craving the sandwiches menu. I just tried the banmi yesterday and I actually stopped by after my class to try another sandwich!
Pho-king amazing. I'm wary of food in Vegas, and this place was absolutely fantastic. I got a mixed seafood pho and it was really good. Pretty easy to get to from the strip, and great service.

My family and I have been here multiple times, it's always clean never loud and service is great
. But plllleease bring back chicken broth! My fiancé enjoys chicken broth more than the pork and beef broth.

So I was surprised at how badly this place sucked across the board. 

Service: We had to wait ten minutes even though there were eight open tables. They were all dirty and filled with dishes and food from previous customers. No one tried to clean them the entire time we were there.

Food: The pho was pretty bad. It was bland and flavorless. The noodles were upon soggy arrival. At 8.50 a bowl, I expected more. I got the combination banh mi and again, it was dry and flavorless. I hope you see the trend here.

Price: It was standard though a bit pricey than your average Vietnamese joint. Banh mi was 3.25, pho at 8.50, and other dishes $10 or so.

I would not come back. Although I guess I got one free egg roll for mentioning yelp and that was pretty tasty. Other than that, I was very disappointed.

I stopped in because I was starving and had a killer hangover, and this was close. Everyone knows a big bowl of pho is the cure all for a hangover.

I got spring rolls, a brisket pho, and a Bahn MI sandwich. I would give the sandwich 5 stars alone. Best one I've ever had. The pho was EXTREMELY salty. So salty, after a while, my mouth hurt. The flavor was okay and the meat was good but the salt content was insane. The spring rolls were pretty standard. Tasty. The peanut sauce though literally just tasted like peanut butter out of a jar. The pho didn't have as much sides as usual, either. (Green onion, bean sprous,regular onion, cilantro, ect.) The bean spouts were actually completely omitted. 

I dunno. This place is good. I'll be back for a sandwich again for sure. Maybe I'll try another soup. Could be an off night.
First time trying Vietnamese. The food here was awesome! Staff were wonderful and the food was so cheap. The sandwiches were very tasty!
Not sure why this place rates so high with other Yelpers.  Maybe people in Vegas aren't exposed to good Pho like in CA. The dishes here are mediocre at best.

Nice balance of dishes, though not many are for pure vegetarians. Pho, while rather standard, is made of fresh veggies and a nice variety (mushrooms are extra $2 if you want them added to the vegetables/tofu pho). Crew is friendly and attentive.

Their pho was on point for me when I first had it which was around opening time but when I went the second time around and this time it was at night towards closing time, their broth wasn't as tasteful and hot. It was warm and bland. However, their grilled pork bahn mi was great!! The bread is the right amount of crisp on the outside and soft on the inside! Had to order some to go!!

My neighborhood pho spot always delivers just what I am looking for. I get the rare beef pho, usually to go. No extra helping of noodles needed, and once all fixings are added the soup has some decent spice and plenty of flavor. When the weather gets cold I find myself running in there all the time. The banh mi sandwiches are ok, although I personally prefer Mr. Lee.

This restaurant is so underrated in terms of popularity around my circle of friends (not a lot of people I know come her but now they will!!!).

This may be unusual but I appreciate a spot with good water. Most places in China Town have water that taste too... chemically. They have the best asian restaurant tap water and that means a lot. Clean, yummy water means clean pipes and cleaner foods.

I applaud this place.

Their pho soup is great! It's not too thick or light and doesn't seem to have too much grease sitting. I tried their pho tai chin and loved it. 

Their service is great as well. Two different servers kept asking if we needed anything. They even let us put a Monster energy drink in their fridge so that it can be kept cool.

I recommend this place and will be back if I hit Vegas!

Solid Pho place!!! No frills, good food.
Technically this is a solid 3 star if compared to some of the best Pho places I've had.

If this was compared to food in Vegas ONLY, I'd probably would rate this a 4.

I saw Pho Thanh Huong listed in a magazine recently as a great place to get good, cheap food. The article mentioned the bahn mi sandwiches as a great inexpensive lunch. Pho Thanh is pretty close to my work so I decided to give it a try. I had been here once before a year or two ago and had one of their combination plates which was fine but had not beckoned me back. The article did, and I decided to try one of their sandwiches.

I ordered the grilled pork bahn mi and my wife ordered the grilled chicken bahn mi. They came served on nice, crusty bread. The fillings were flavorful. The price was great (just over $3 each). While the portion was not huge it was sufficient for a lunch. 

I'm glad I gave Pho Thanh Huong another try, and I will definitely be back.

The advantage of having a big family is that you get to try different things! The grilled pork either in the Banh Mi or the Bun is a must. The broth for the Pho was the best I've ever had. The fried spring rolls were really good. To drink I recommend the soursop (guanabana) and mango shake. They are delicious and taste just like fresh fruit. I'm glad this is where we chose to eat on our over night stay in Vegas.

I go here when I'm desperate for a quick Vietnamese sandwich.

I don't know what happened but when that place changed management and painted the restaurant it has the most horrible stench in there.

I can't tell if it's cigarette smoke, and at first I thought it was just lingering from a smoker but it's been months and the past 4 times I've been there, it smells horrible.

Unless you don't care about smell when you eat (which I'm pretty sure I'd rather smell roses than cigarettes when I eat) then eat here. But if you care, then find a new place and tell me about it.

I honestly had to wait outside while I waited for my sandwich.

Harsh? Yikes. Sorry. It's the truth

(I hope some worker there sees this and fixes this problem. Yes, I have mentioned it to them before but I don't know how helpful it was)

Hot Soup for this chilly weather!!! Not the best place, though, but it'll do for now. The waiter (who may be a relative of the owner) looked annoyed at his job. He was rolling his eyes and was not very accommodating. After asking one question, he made me feel uncomfortable about asking another one. Yes, it is very near home (and near UNLV where I usually study at) but to be honest, I'd rather drive a few more miles for a better experience. Price was a little more than others too and they're not even great. I will probably go somewhere else if there are other options.

Not bad for a restaurant outside of Chinatown. The pho, bun bo hue and banh mi are fairly good and reasonable priced. The appetizers and drinks aren't too bad either. The restaurant is clean and the decor is plain. The service isn't so good. I had to get the waiter's attention a few times. Overall not too bad.

Pho has long been my cure for a hangover and it is vital to know where to get a good bowl of Pho in Vegas to do the trick and cure that hangover.  Overall, this place is good.  The Cafe Sua Da, Spring Rolls, and Banh Mi Sandwiches are legit!  But, the service and the pho could be a little better.  My suggestion would be to get something more than just a regular Pho Tai.  It definitely isn't bad and I would still go back to this place but I left still feeling a little empty.

The first time I tried their Banh mi, it was delicious and the spring rolls are fresh and crispy very satisfying! they took a little long to get our food..the place was empty...but the grilled pork was great, I came back a different night before I left town and was a bit disappointing, granted I ate it all...I WAS HUNGRY, SUE ME!! but the food tasted like it was warmed up in a microwave..it prolly was since we came 30 minutes before they closed. I give it 3 stars for the spring rolls!

This Pho and Vietnamese restaurant in a small strip plaza across from UNLV is just about a 10 minute drive from the Strip.  

We went in on Thanksgiving Day, after leaving the airport, at about 2pm and found it not that crowded after lunch.  

We were quickly greeted and seated. We ordered some Smoothies with Boba, which were amazing.  

Unfortunately, I do not recall exactly what I ordered; however, the taste was great. It was appealing to the eye, tasted great, and the price was reasonable with large portions.

Definitely would recommend.

I liked the grilled pork bahn mi. It had just enough filling for me not to complain and at $2.75, it's a pretty damn good deal. That seems to be the going rate across the country if you've had these before. The outside crust of the bread could have been crispier other than that it was great. Do yourself a favor and don't order the crepe. Nuf said regarding that.

I discovered Pho about 4 years ago, and from that moment forward I knew that it would be one of those dishes that you wake in the middle of the night craving. 

The pho here is fairly basic, and although it gets the job done, it doesn't really stand up to most others I've had. The broth is a little light, and I often have trouble getting everything in it that I want due to the fact that the servers and counter workers don't really understand what I want if it's not already on the menu. They pretty much rely on me pointing to a picture or a number, but if you want something extra or a substitution forget about it unless you speak vietnamese.

The menu is also basic, and there are not many soup options other than pho, which is fine because the real star here are the banh mi sandwiches, which they do exceptionally well, with a great toasted bread and they are one of the few places I have found that have the option of the shredded pork skin sandwich. Plus you can't beat the price...I get this as my to go school lunch many days to take to campus. Pork skin banh mi and a can of coke is $4.25.

I don't think this place would survive very long on Spring Mountain, but tucked away in the Vonn's shopping center, and in proximity to UNLV this place will continue to be my go to spot for a great cheap sack lunch, but I would probably make the trip to Chinatown if I wanted Pho.

I've been to this location twice now and had very similar experiences both times. The service was decent, everyone was very pleasant to interact with. However I ordered a blended smoothie with boba and it came out as I was nearly finishing my pho which was a little frustrating. The pho itself was decent, not amazing, but decent, and the fresh spring rolls were pretty good. Overall a good option for a quick pho fix but there are many other options in town that greatly outshine this particular restaurant for pho.

Hmmm, where to start. We get to the restaurant and we're seated immediately. I ordered a short rib sandwich and my other 3 friends got pho. When the pho came out, one was incorrect so they let us keep it. We waited 30 minutes for his vegetable pho  and my sandwich which never came out. Once his pho finally came out, there was a huge strand of hair in it. We spoke with the manager Kathy and what she offered us 20% off ($5) our meal. The waiters obviously felt bad and held their head down. The waitress offered something for free to go but Kathy butted in and said no they don't have time. Oh we don't? Okay.

So to conclude, I never got my sandwich, 30 minutes to make vegetable pho, and hair in said pho. Garbage. Save yourself a trip, don't go here.

Very delicious vegetarian pho. My husband had a seafood pho and said delicious as well. It was pass 9pm, all the shops near our house were closed. This place was a great find. The server girls are so efficient and attentive.

When the craving hits and china town is too far away. Finding a good banh mi sandwich is hit and miss but this place is spot on. Always clean , friendly staff and good food.  Also the portions are awesome lots of meat in the sandwiches, bread is always fresh. Great prices for students and hungry folks on a budget.

Hung over from your hardcore partying at (fill-in-the-club-name-here)??

A nice, steaming bowl of pho is the perfect fix, and Pho Thanh Huong makes it gooooood.  Their broken rice (com tam) dishes are also delish.  Make sure to get the tau hu ky (shrimp in tofu paper?).

The restaurant is bright and will definitely wake you up.  Wear your sunglasses if needed.  The prices are cheap, the food is good.  What else do you need?

When you've nursed yourself back to life, make sure to buy some Vietnamese sandwiches for later!  The shredded chicken sandwich is yummmmm.

This is my favorite go to phô restaurant! They never fail me everytime! Very good service, very cozy place and very good food! Their grilled beef ribs just melts in your mouth, and their Phô are the best! I would recommend this to all my friends!
Best Pho ever! The broth is simply amazing!!! It's addicting :). They also have it to go, they make sure to pack it securely so nothing spills.  Never had issues to get it home safely.

Pretty solid pho/Vietnamese restaurant. One reviewer said they smelled acetone from the nail salon next door. But yet, the minute I walked in, I got a strong, disgusting wift of stale cigarette smoke. =/ I continue to smell that throughout my dinner. That nasty Dotty's dump next door must be the culprit. 

I'll definitely say this: at $8.50 a bowl of Pho Tai, it was on the pricey side....especially since this place is not even located on the strip!!! Pho So 1 doesn't even charge that much!!! Pretty awesome pho though, I have to admit. 
So my boyfriend and I each got a bowl of pho and he ordered the grilled pork banh mi which only cost $3.50. Awesome price for a very flavorful, charboiled pork sandwich. YUM!!!!! I can tell this would be perfect for UNLV students, since this restaurant is close by. The sandwich was delicious, decent sized and it was cheap. 

We came for dinner on a cold, rainy Monday night. Plenty of seating available, we were serviced right away and the food arrived within 3 minutes. Restaurant was clean (to the naked eye that is...) and what I loved most were the individually-wrapped bamboo chopsticks. I like those because these were a one-time use only. (you know how some Asian restaurants can be when it comes to cleanliness.) Solid restaurant for pho and that dang delicious grilled pork banh mi if you're ever on this side of town.

This is my go-to spot when I'm near UNLV. They have awesome pho and their sandwiches are amaizing! The grilled pork is only 3.50 and also give a discount to UNLV students. I recently found the grilled beef sandwich which is supper bomb. Check them out if you are in the are you wont regret it.

So so...friendly service, average portions, fairly good food. Pho, banh mi, the usual suspects.
Not the best I've had but I'd go again, if I was in the neighborhood.

Really good Pho.
I have had nothing buy Pho here, I keep wanting to get something else, but I can't.
I take that back, I ordered egg rolls once, they were good, but I couldn't finish my Pho...not worth it.

Cheap and decent Vietnamese. 

Mushroom pho was $8.50 and grilled pork banh mi was $4.25. Both decent and priced well. 

The suong sao nuoc da grass jelly with coconut cream was $3.50 and delicious. Thai tea was $4 and missable.

I've been here a LONG time ago but since returning last month, I've noticed they changed up the restaurant and menu slightly.  The restaurant looks nice and clean, the service was very friendly and welcoming.   I've had the pleasure of sitting down to a nice bowl of Pho and they definitely improved on the flavors.  

One of the good things about their Pho menu is it's newbie-friendly.   There's a picture of the different meats/ingredients, and you could choose to add any or all to your pho.   All the staples are there and then some.  I personally love everything but tripe in my soup.  The different cooked meats, meatballs, tendon.. so delicious.  

More importantly though, their Bahn Mi (vietnamese sandwiches) are SO good here.   They bake their bread fresh and the portions of their meat and veggies are excellent.  I always order the grilled pork.  Just a tip: the Jalapeno slices they top the sandwich with are hot.  So ask them to put it on the side if you aren't sure you'd like them.

I've also enjoyed their vietnamese meatball sandwich, but their egg and chinese sausage sandwich wasn't much to talk about.

I've already bought 6 sandwiches and brought them to my co-workers.  They are IN LOVE with it.   Super damn good!

Worst customer service I have ever encountered, stood 5 minutes by the register, although the rude waitress looked at me at least three times, never said anything or smiled.  Just walked out, avoid this place. Whish I can rate them with zero stars!

I was in town for work and whenever I travel, I always find Vietnamese restaurants to try.  I did a Yelp search and Pho Thanh Huong came up.  I walked in and could smell the anise floating in the air.  I got seated right away and ordered the following:

Meatball pho ($8.50): it was so good!!  Portion was huge, lots of meat and other goodies.  

Vietnamese Ham, pork and Pate Banh Mi ($3.25): it was good too, I haven't had one of these sandwiches in a while so it was so good. 

I definitely walked out of the restaurant a happy camper.

So, everyone needs a bowl of pho at some point when you go to Vegas (it's the perfect hangover remedy!)-
This is most definitely the place to come to!!!

We were actually here for a weekend volleyball tournament. We ended up coming here twice in 3 days! Everything we had was so good- pho tai, bun, banh mi, spring rolls, soda chanh... NOTHING disappointed!

The grilled pork banh mi were only $3.25 and delicious!!! They actually make their bread there on site, & it's as good as the best I've had in SoCal!!!

The pho broth was so, so good- not too salty or strong. The noodles were perfectly cooked & never got soggy!
Service was great & the restaurant was clean. A short drive down from the Strip in a random strip mall across the street from the UNLV Campus~ well worth the short trek down from any of the big hotels!

I decided to introduce my mom to Pho.  She'd never heard of it and had no idea what she was getting into.  She loves Asian food in general, so I thought we'd give it a try.  I was actually going to go to the Thai place next door, but spied the Pho Thanh Huong and decided to change gears last minute.

The food was wonderful.  I cannot complain about the huge portions or amazing flavors.  The broth in the Pho was some of the best I've had.  The prices were also fantastic.

My one complaint, and the reason for four stars instead of five is the service.  Even though it was 1pm and there were quite a few tables, there was only one server.  He forgot that we'd ordered spring rolls and took forever in bringing our check.  Once the other tables had cleared out, I still had to hunt him down.  Minor in the grand scheme of things.
Omg! This is the spot for Vietnamese! The food came out fast, hot and fresh! The employees were the sweetest! Huge portions! Come hungry!

The first time I came here it was the perfect cure for the morning hangover and portions were perfect. Recently, I returned hoping for the same great experience and it was extremely disappointing. I didn't try the sandwiches but the pho was less than satisfying. I got the combo special and felt like the portions were literally cut in half and I didn't see any tripe. I was lucky enough to get half a meatball! I would come back but next time I'm gonna pay 7 bucks for the large bowl. Shrimp rolls were bomb though.

Pho? On the East Side? Are you kidding? 
No, not kidding. It's pretty darned good, too. And their Banh Mi are FANTASTIC!

Soild Pho and Vermecelli. Dont expect much in terms of service you are lucky if they take your order within 10 minutes of sitting down but the food speaks for itself and I enjoy this place for lunch when in Las Vegas.

BLECH-itude.  From the second we pulled into the older strip mall where this resto is located, I had a feeling I wasn't going to like it. The feeling continued when I walked in and got the distinct smell of recent cigarette smoking (perhaps from within the kitchen?) No matter, I thought to myself - the banh mi will be worth it.  I was (sniff sniff) wrong.  Though the bread was warm, it didn't have the flakiness that I've come to enjoy with good banh mi, and the filling to bread ratio was sadly lacking.  The daikon/carrot mix inside the 'wich overpowered all of its other flavors... so much so that I kept adding chili sambal paste to make this meal go down easier.  Even my banh mi companion (she believes herself to be an expert) admitted that the food was below sub-par. Add to that the overall inattentiveness of the staff, and well... SIGH. Too bad.  I really wanted to like this place after reading some of the rave reviews but, after my experience, don't think I'll be returning.  Only highlight: the low prices -- $3 for a 'wich ain't bad.... but the old adage, "You get what you pay for...." seems to ring true here.

This place is such a hidden gem. The pho is well seasoned, not salty and very delicious! We had two pho veggie bowls with noodles and we left feeling more than satisfied and energized. The staff is friendly and I'll definitely be coming back for more.

Thus far, best Pho in Vegas! Not too far from the Strip, inexpensive, close to the airport,  decent service.

Being local, the fam and I frequent this place when we are in the mood for Pho or Bahn Mi sandwiches. Always on point. Their egg rolls are amazing too! Been to several others around town and the broth here is such a level above the others. Sooo good!

Hope that you give this place a shot. It is well worth it!

Everything was good, pho broth was on point, the vietnamese ice coffee was really good, the vermecelli was delish, the pork meat has great seasonings. All in all one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in Vegas and Its down the street from MGM. Love it totally coming back for more.

Greetings Yelpers. The sandwich here is pretty good. I took my sister here last night at 930pm. I saw a guy looking at us and getting ready to turn off the "Open" sign. (I thought nothing of it at the time) 

As we walked in the shop, I turned to the guy and said, "Go ahead, turn it off. We are just ordering sandwiches." The cashier simply smiled and just stood there. Some girl (perhaps one of the waitress) said, "Oh, we are out of bread." 

SERIOUSLY?!  It's not even closing time. It's a sandwich shop. 

VERY DISAPPOINTED!

The proximity of this restaurant and the Banh Mi are the home-runners for me.

Thank the Yelp gods for this small gem! During the four years of attending UNLV, I would've been delighted to know there was such a yummy Vietnamese restaurant just across campus. There has been numerous times I craved pho or banh mi but did not have the 10-15 minutes to drive to Chinatown.

I had some bad experiences with previous pho restaurants regarding service, but this place is great. No need to wave down waiters to get a refill for my drink. Also the venue is clean and tidy.

I had the fried egg and Chinese sausage banh mi. The bread is toasted nearly perfect. It is crunchy yet crumbles away effortlessly, almost just melting away in your mouth. No need to chew and bite endlessly like with the bland toasted bread from Subway. Damn, did I just compare this place to Subway? Yeah right. Anyways, the fried egg and Chinese sausage was great, just a little too salty. I would definitely tell them to hold the salt next time. However, only $3.50 for this tasty sandwich? I can roll with that any day!

My girlfriend had the vegetarian pho and the broth looked and tasted spectacular. I really dislike how some pho are served drenched in oil. I hate seeing pockets of oil floating around in my broth, yuck! Thankfully, the broth was very clean and tasty. Maybe because it was vegetarian pho the broth was clearer than usual. I normally have beef or shrimp pho, so next time I will try that.

In conclusion, I really like the location of this venue and the banh mi. Definitely recommending this place, not only because location but for its surprisingly tasty dishes as well.

I can't believe I had never been here when I studied at UNLV. Anyways, I came here during my lunch break today and ordered the rare steak pho. Not sure if it was because I was feeling under the weather, but the pho definitely hit the spot! The broth was flavorful enough that I didn't have to add hoisin sauce, and the rice noodles were chewy and amazing!! I'm definitely coming back next time.
Came to this place after day 1 of EDC and it was pretty damn good! Vermicelli bowl, banh mi, and pho are all delicious. Very clean and good service!

The wife and I stopped in for lunch. I had the pho and the wife had the Banh Mi Thit Nuong pork sandwich. 
The pho was some of the best I've had. Plenty of noodles and vegetables in a wonderful beef broth. It was fantastic. 
The pork in the sandwich was to die for! My wife said that it had just the right amount of spicy and sweet. It had a great smokey flavor as well.
The service was good and the restaurant seemed to be very clean.
The prices are very fair, especially for the sandwich.
Loved it!

I go to this pho spot not only because it's good, but it's near school as well. I always get the chicken pho or the tofu pho ; that's only because I don't eat read meat or pork. Anyway, I think their phos good.. The chicken is never over cooked to make it super chewy, the tofu is just enough firmness. The portion size is huge! I never really finish my bowl, but I would take it to go so I have left overs for later. The size of the bowl is great for the price! I think the chicken pho is $8? But for a huge bowl and you can take left overs home... That's a steal! 
The customer services is great too! There's this particular waiter, his names Elmer & he's so friendly and attentive. He never lets my drink run low & frequently checks up on our table to see how we're doing. Keep up the good pho and customer service!

4.5 Stars.

WOW. What can I say, in cities with a plethora of vietnamese restaurants like Dallas or Houston, this is actually better than most that I have been to. The dishes are a little bit more expensive than the ones around here, but the quality makes it worth it. I was skeptical at first, but after the first bite, I wish this restaurant would replace several around the dallas area.

Grilled pork chops with rice and a fried egg, Beef ribs with rice, and a large bowl of Pho. Everything ordered was very tasty and I would order again without hesitation. Also tried a grilled pork and pate sandwich of also great tasting. I even drank the broth soup till it was all gone. Another place I am hitting again when I am back in Vegas. Thank you Yelpers. =)

I love you, Pho Thanh Huong.  I can't pronounce your name, so I call you "That sandwich place at school."  The prices are perfect, the sandwiches are incredible (My criterion for good food is that I lay up at night in bed sometimes and want it.  This has happened a few times already.)

The decor is really much better than it was, and there is AC now, with a few portable (and quiet) units.  The service is quick when you do sit-down, and they're nice enough people, but of course they're not 5-star-restaurant material.  Highly recommended, get #1, it's the most flavorful.  The best thing to do when going with someone is to share a pho (which ever one you like) and a sandwich each.  That way you avoid over-ordering.  This will probably run you about $12.  

A great local place, so good, and so cheap, you could eat here every day!  (Or I could.)  (if I wasn't a broke college student).

This is a very good Vietnamese restaurant and it's located just 2 miles off the strip. I was craving a Vietnamese sandwich while vacationing in Vegas (can't help it, I love them) and my family came across this lovely restaurant. They have a huge selection of sandwiches and other dishes. Of course I ordered the Steamed Pork sandwich; it was the BEST Vietnamese sandwich I've ever had, no joke (I had the sandwich twice during my week stay). They filled it with plenty of meat and vegetables and they even bake their own bread! It had a lot of taste and their pate (some sort of meat spread, pronounced "pat-tay") wasn't bland. My family also enjoyed their meals; my sister loved her grilled pork with rice because it had delicious flavor.

The restaurant itself was pretty big, but I think a lot of people order to go as I kept seeing people walk in and out with goodies. I wish they had a sister store in California. Why when I finally find a place I like does it have to be so far? I guess that gives me another reason to go to Vegas! I will definitely return here again!

I am Vietnamese and moved to LV recently and have been looking for traditional Vietnamese cuisine. This place is good for banh mi sandwiches and rice plates but lacks traditional Vietnamese value in the vermicelli noodle bowls and appetizers. I am disappointed with the quantity of food you get in takeout, I feel like it's far less than other places. The deep fried egg rolls traditionally are rice paper filled with noodles, veggies, and lettuce. This restaurant however, does it the cheap way. They use a different wrap that's not rice paper and fill it with a big piece of meat. It's just a log of sausage. Traditional Vietnamese egg rolls are extremely different and better. I am disappointed that this restaurant and many other pho restaurants in the area don't do real authentic traditional egg rolls. 

The pork and shrimp vermicelli was great, the nuoc mum was a little sweeter than what I prefer but was still great. Overall it's an okay restaurant but for someone like me who is Vietnamese and knows tradition....I'll stick to a place that's more authentic.

Some of the best pho I've eaten! Naturally, this was the best cure to quite a long night out on the strip. The broth was super onion-y, which made it really flavorful. Only downside is that it was a bit more pricey than normal.. $9 for a bowl of pho? Doesn't make much sense, but the service and food were great. Nice little find out in Vegas.

we ALWAYS eat at this place whenever we go to vegas.  nevermind that i live in the southbay where pho restaurants are on every corner.  this place is good, even coming from a vietnamese person who eats this stuff all the time.  try the chicken pho...its my

Located within a dumpy strip mall across from UNLV, I find myself coming here all the time, and picking up 5 banh mi sandwiches for carryout for $15 total.  The sandwiches are great - I put them in the over to toast up the bread a little and it's absolutely delicious.  It's one of my regular places as a Las Vegas local.  

I have had banh mi in many places, including California and Virginia, which have vibrant Vietnamese communities.  Oddly, the best one out of all of them thus far is here in Vegas.  The bread is fresh and had a nice chewiness to it; the grilled pork sandwiches have pork that don't have too much gristle, and the sandwiches use good vegetables.  The other inferior places I've been to have meager portions of meat, or cost $3.50 and upwards per sandwich, or had bread that I wasn't particularly fond of.  

I did have pho there once, and was disappointed by it; I go to Pho Saigon 8 up on Spring Mountain for my pho needs, but will often come here after a meal there for sandwiches to eat during the course of the week.  I put in my order, and go to the Vons in the same strip mall to finish up some shopping (it's an incredibly ghetto Vons).  

The decor is pretty lousy, though they have a flat screen tv up.  The service is spotty though I've been there enough times that they recognize me; they're not rude, but they aren't necessarily on top of everything.

Cleanliness is average.  The banh mi is prepared in the open area in direct view of anyone, which I like since it can help keep a kitchen honest.  Value is solid because of the high quality of banh mi and reasonable prices.  As said by others, you'll be best off if you stick with the sandwiches.

Also, avoid the place during UNLV basketball games, cheapskates come out here to park rather than parking at the arena and it makes the entire lot a zoo.

The waiter was very friendly and helpful. The service was quick. The pho was really good and came with a lot of meat which was nice. The grilled pork banh mi was very generous with its meat and tasted really good.
My family loved the banh mi's here! Their other dishes were really good as well. We definitely enjoyed our lunch here and will be back to take some banh mi's on the trip back to Utah.

Love this vietnamese restaurant! I really enjoy the Pho here.  The noodles are cooked perfectly and the broth is very comforting while packing a lot of flavor.  I can't get a decent bowl of Pho where I live so it's always a nice treat when I come to Vegas and get a taste of this place.

My most favorite thing about PTH is their sandwiches!!! The last time I went I got the grilled pork & the grilled chicken with pate.  Both were sooo GOOD!  I love the bread that they use.  Yes I like Lee's in the OC but their bread is too hard.  The bread is here light & fluffy, toasted & a great compliment to whichever meat you order.  I really liked their pickled carrots & daikon here, along with the slices of jalapeno inside.  Definitely a keeper in my book.  Plus each sandwich is $2.75!! Talk about dirt cheap.  

I'm full every time I leave & my wallet doesn't yell at me.  Wish I could go here every week!! WAAAAAH!
Pretty good banh mi. Service was fine and sandwich was fresh and delivered pronto. I liked the little slice of heat on it but felt like the sauce could have been better.

The Banh mi thit cha was legit, and the spring rolls were good. Came here after reading the Las Vegas Weekly article on top 10 sandwiches and this was on there it was definately delicious and dirt cheap

Do the banh mi dance!

You take one banh mi in one hand, and another banh mi in another.  And then you dance spastically, but also slowly.  You're pretty much randomly jousting the sammies at people, I think.  One of my friends invented the dance.  Not me.

Anyway, the banh mi is pretty good here.  The bread is soft and fluffy like a cloud.  It isn't a long baguette.  It is more of an ovular shape.  (Perfect shape for banh mi dances). Stout would be the correct way to describe it.  The grilled pork is flavorful and tangy.  The jalapeños give you a nice kick in the pants.  The ratio of meat to radishes to jalapeños to cilantro is just perfect.  At $2.50 and some change, this is the cheapest and tastiest near the strip!

The service was a bit slow. There were quite a few people eating when myself and my friend arrived and it took a very long time for someone to finally come take our order. The drinks we ordered were iced coffee and were not brought right away but about 5 minutes after ordering. The coffee was very good and very strong, perfect for Vegas hangover. I ordered a pork sandwich and it was so good. The meat was great and the bread was so light and fresh. I could tell they bake the bread on-site everyday. I really enjoyed the food here and would eat there again. The pho looked really good too from what I could see around me.

With all honesty. I am surprise about the ratings. We called this store in advance, one of workers picked up the phone and just suddenly hang up the phone; therefore, we just went straight to the store.

When we got to the store, there were tables open; a table with four seats to be exact. No one was in line; we (there was 3 of us) were the only one. We didn't get seated until after 15-20 minutes of waiting. 

When we got seated, we knew what to order and we were ready, but one of the male waiter told us to wait. We waited for 20 minutes just for a different waiter to get our order! Some of the customers that came after us got their order first. I get that theyre busy but they should atleast try and accomadate or atleast reassure the customer. 

The restaurant, in my opinion, lacks organization or control; everyone seemed to be all over the place.

As for the food, I thought it was delicious. Definitely worth coming back to. The place is clean. However, with the experience that we had, coming for the first time, we probably wont come back. Sorry no tip.

Ordered: 
Pho Dac Biet
Banh Mi Thit Nuong

Loved both items that I ordered. The baguette is made at the location and it's made perfectly. It's hard on the outside and soft on the inside. The flavor of the meat is sweet and savory. The banh mi is just perfect! . The pho was actually flavorful unlike most locations where it tastes a bit watered down. Pretty much always here for lunch!

I ordered a #1 Grilled Pork based on reviews here and the milky eye guy said it was most popular.  It measures 7" compared with 9"+ elsewhere. They are pretty light on vegetables and do not use cucumbers.  The pork was decent, maybe next time I'll have them add pate.

I took the advice of another Yelper and did a little shopping at Vons while they made the sandwich so I don't know how long it took to prepare.

I like the banh mi at Hue Thai better although more expensive.
Amazing banh mi sandwiches - the pork was seasoned very well and super tasty. The bread was soft and fresh. For the noodles, the meat portions are quite generous as well! I will definitely be back.
great pho . long wait , but you then that the food is fresh

My server did not speak English.  There was no A/C.  But holy crap this place serves some damn good pho!   Completely off-strip location in a random strip mall.  Dirt cheap Alhambra-esque pricing.

Bring a towel to wipe your sweat and $6 in your pocket.  What a find.

Great. The only place of its kind that I know. The prices and food are fantastic. That area may be a bit creepy to some at night, so if you are creeped out easily, try it during the day for lunch. My friend who took me there told me it was 'French Vietnamese', and thus the presence of their own bread for their sandwiches.

4.5 stars

I've tried a couple Vietnamese spots around town, and I gotta say that so far, Pho Thanh Huong has the best pho in Vegas. It's clean yet flavorful, and the noodles have the perfect texture, not too chewy nor too soft. Perfect for a chilly winter day. The egg rolls were really good along with the pork banh mi. They make their own baguettes here, and it was served fresh, had a nice crunch to it. 

Service was great as well. Will definitely be back!
Delicious Vietnamese food! I had the pho ga and it was one of the best I've ever had. My dinner was served very quickly, within just two or three minutes.
Another delicious Pho. Wow. This time I was smart and ordered 2 pork Bahn Mis!  As usual, the staff is super nice.
I've been here before and every time I go to a pho restaurant I get the pho dac biet. This is probably my fave pho restaurant here in Vegas, everything is so good and fresh!

Pretty decent place, the area is clean and the service was pretty good too. I ordered the Pho Ga, and the noodles were very thin and that's the way I like it. :) I think the pho was kind of bland and needed a tiny bit more flavor. But that's okay, I guess. I believe it was about 9$ for a bowl of pho, which is pretty expensive.

Really great pho! Very reasonable price comparing to California & Chicago (where my family and I live), great taste and big size! Just bookmarked the place and certainly coming back next time I'm here!:D

P.S. their Vietnamese coffee is great too!

On first glance, you will notice that the prices are STEEP here.  I mean, 12 dollars for a bowl of pho (large size) is pretty ridiculous.  But, I'm comparing that to southern cali prices and this IS vegas afterall.  After ordering the large bowl of pho, I now I understand why they charge you a pot of gold for it.  The large pho is ridiculously huge, probably one of the biggest bowls of pho I've ever seen.  You can easily feed 3 hungover people on a large bowl.  While it wasn't the best bowl of pho I've ever had, it's decent enough to deliver some nutrients to you're malnourished-starved body after a hard night of partying and some crying in the shower.  

3 stars.

Tip: If you need to rehydrate, go ahead and order a fresh coconut here.  It'll run you $4, which is not much for some much needed electrolytes.

I didn't try the pho here, but their bahn mi is awesome. I'm originally from Seattle and I'm so happy to have found a place that sells Vietnamese sandwiches. Of course in Seattle you can still find them for a buck a piece, but I suppose beggers can't be choosers out here in the desert. My only complaints were that the restaurant smelled a little dingy and the young guy who helped me was kind of a jerk. Other than that I'd definitely go back for those sandwiches!

My group of 15 family members arrived in Vegas for our family reunion, very ready to eat. We decided to try this place because it's a combination of my mom and dad's names (what a coincidence/silly, I know). 

We walk in and are hit with what I think was the smell of acetone floating in through the vents connected to the nail salon next door. Gross. 

We were seated quickly and service was decent. Fortunately, the food started rolling out pretty soon (must have had pho on deck) and we could not longer smell the acetone. 

I ordered the lemongrass chicken with rice. It was pretty good (tender chicken, fluffy rice), although the sauce was a little too intense for me. I tried some of my brother's pho, and I was not super impressed by the broth. Not sure I'd ever go back, but if I do, I'll probably try a different rice plate.

Every time we come to Vegas, we come here for authentic flavors and incredibly inexpensive prices. The $3.50 fried egg and Chinese sausage sandwich is a steal. The grilled beef sandwich is very tasty. The pickled lime soda tastes home made and is a great antidote to the summer heat.

New to Vegas, of course I had to try out the pho. I had the mien tom which they were nice enough to make since its not really in their menu which I appreciated. All was very yummy although I do wish they'd have a vegetarian broth. Overall I was a happy camper and they were very generous with their toppings !
I grew up on vietnamese sandwiches and I have to say this place is my favorite. Dakao is pretty good but this place is bomb!

Came across this place by accident. Glad we stopped in. After a long day of shopping this really hit the spot.Tried this place pretty good. I would come back when I'm visiting Vegas. The spring rolls not so good
Great service very clean and I can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu. So many choices and I can only eat one item at a sitting.
Excellent vegetarian pho! Broth is light and warming to the soul! Also, egg rolls = bomb town!!!

Ok so we went to another Vietnamese place that will not be named last night, and it was awful.  This morning my family was missing rice so they wanted to go to a Vietnamese place that was actually great.  Pho THanh Huong did not disappoint.  

We went in around 12 o clock, it was fairly busy but we were seated instantly.  The place was nice and clean, the server was really nice.  He also spoke Vietnamese with my parents which is a huge plus.  We ordered 3 broken rice plates with the grilled pork, the bi, and the pork loaf.  Then we also ordered a plate of the shaken beef, and the grilled pork.  We finished the order with 2 glasses of orange  juice and three glasses of iced coffee.  The food and dirnks came out about the same time, and it took about twenty minutes.  our server kept coming back and apologizing to us for the wait.  We were perfectly fine, he was very attentive and overall just awesome.  Major props.

When the food arrived everything was nice and hot.  The pork was sweet and juicy.  The fish sauce that the rice came with was on point, the bi and pork loaf was really well done, and the veggies it came with was crisp and tasty.  

In the end, my family really enjoyed the experience of Pho Thanh Huong.  The plates were large and delicious.  This is definitely my go to spot.  Well done to them and keep being awesome!

I really wanted bun rieu and decided to give Pho Thanh Huong a try.  I didn't care for it.  The flavor is not strong enough.  The color was way too light to be called bun rieu.   I didn't see much rieu but a hodge podge of other ingredients.  There was a crab claw in there that I didn't even bother to taste as I don't know how long it has been frozen.  The pork hock was super tiny.  I decided to make bun rieu last weekend just because of my disappointment at Pho Thanh Huong.  I also got a grilled pork banh mi to-go, which was decent.

Service was good.  But, there is plenty of better restaurants so I won't be returning.

IMO, one of the best pho I've had in Las Vegas. Maybe it tasted better because I wasn't too busy being pissed off at shitty service I usually get at the other more popular pho restaurants?

My last time here was a LONG time ago, and I've been waiting to be around the area to go again. Tonight, I noticed they redesigned their menus and made some other changes to the decor. It looks nicer than last time.

The boyfriend and I normally get #28 the Special Rice Combo which comes with rice (duh), grilled pork, grilled shrimp and 2 fried eggrolls. Has a small side of vegetables (pickled carrots and daikon radish on top of lettuce, and tomatoes and cucumbers). I'm in love with pork and theirs is scrumptious. But their grilled shrimp is pretty amazing also... one of the best shrimp I've ever had AND THEY DE-VEIN THE SHRIMP! All this for $9.50!! And they make the shrimp look pretty... If that matters to you...

We also got the spring rolls.. they could use a little more "umph" since there was only like one slice of meat in it but their peanut sauce is good.

I told my boyfriend I don't think I want to go to any other Vietnamese restaurant other than here from now on. He HATES pho (yeah i know, who hates pho?!) but he took a small bite of mine and liked it so that means something, right?

Also idk about during the normal lunch/dinner hours because we normally come here around 9:30pm but we've never had to wait to be seated and they have pretty good customer service. Not extraordinary service or anything but they check in often, take our orders in a timely manner, refill drinks, etc. which is way more than what you're going to get at places like Pho Kim Long or Pho So 1.

Excellent place for soup, i've been to a lot of places in the search for the best pho soup. I found this place around a year and a half ago and don't go anywhere else, customer service is great...in there so often we don't even have to order, the lady remembers or order right down to the scoop of rice. Its greatly priced kind of far to drive but its worth ever minute of the drive.

I stumbled upon this place while going to the Cuban place in the same lot but it was closed. I am always hungry for a good bahn mi. I walked in to a nice looking restaurant that was completely empty. I ordered a grilled pork and a chicken bahn mi. The heated the bread In a convection oven and it was the star of the show. The meat was already made and stored in a cold counter behind the register. They heated both meats simultaneously in a microwave. I was a little upset they don't grill the meat to order and maybe this is why there were no customers. Not a fan

Stopped in since we were in the area and got a  banh mi. The bread was okay, but not as crunchy as my go to spot, Dakao. The goodies in the sandwich was half as much as I'm used to seeing, and whats worse is that it cost more too.

This place is okay, but I'd rather drive a few more miles to Chinatown if you know what I Mean. With a lot more variety and options to choose from, save yourself the disappointment and wait until tou get to Spring Mountain. You'll be glad you did...ALOHA!!!


YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(312/365) "All Bread, Barely Any Filler"

I came here at 10am on a Monday morning. Ordered the grilled pork (#1) and ham & steam pork sandwiches. Pretty good for a Vegas sandwich but I guess I was expecting more after reading all the other reviews. The bread was good but not great. It's no Lee's where you have that crispy crunchy crust that somehow feels like it melts in your mouth. There were plenty of veggies but they didn't have enough flavor. The veggies have a thinner cut than a Lee's sandwich. They did put enough mayo and pate in the sandwich.
Best Bahn Mi in town!  The bread is always perfect, and the fillings are fresh.  Generous portions at a great price.  Love the mom and son team.

My favorite pho place closes on Sunday's, so we had to try something new this past weekend. Their bahn mi was DELICIOUS, along with their egg rolls. The pho lacked flavor, but wasn't bad. If you're looking for a quick and easy place for pho, this is the place to go.

I used to come here all the time when I was a student at UNLV. Since I graduated & rarely on this side of town, it's been forever since I've been back.

But 5yrs later, their sandwiches are still delicious & STILL around the $3 price range.. SCORE!!!

I got my sandwiches to-go, and the gentleman making them was super nice & helpful. They make the sandwiches right in front of you from scratch, which is a plus knowing that it's fresh.

I even bought sandwiches for my sis & bro-in-law, and they're now fans! We can't wait to come back & buy a bunch of sandwiches to bring home.. haha

Good sandwiches for ridiculously low prices = AWESOME =)
Yum!!!!! This place is delicious. I could eat here every day. The staff is very friendly and brings out your food at very reasonable times.
Always go here for take out when I'm feeling home sick with my partner. she loves the Banh mi thit nuong (grilled pork sandwich which is my fav) and Cha Gio(fried mince pork rolls) Yummy.
Love this place. Best veggie pho in town. Ask for some rare beef added in, and some spring rolls to start. You won't be disappointed :)

My favorite place to slurp on a bowl of hot Pho and inhale delicious tasty sandwiches is Pho Thanh Huong. Portions are generous. A regular size bowl is big enough for 2 depending on how hungry you are and it comes steamy hot right out of the kitchen doors,  with all the plant fixins to garnish your bath tub bowl of soup.
What I like most about their soups is, they dont skimp out on the meat and they give you a variety of proteins to choose from.
The grilled pork and chicken sandwiches are scrumptious, light and crunchy.  Every bite is full of delicious flavor. Very reasonable price for such a bangable sandwich.
Spring rolls, and fried rolls are no doubt delectable. Eat with caution though, as you can easily fill up with these appetizers that your entree may feel neglected... you might need a to go box after 2 bites.
Service is fast and friendly. Easy access, no high traffic customer wait time. Slight downfall is the area. Just be sure not to wear your Gucci jogging suit dripping in gold herring bones. Youll be sure to be jacked before you get to the door.

Ho shit! That boooomb mi was so good. I honestly don't know what to say. I got the grilled pork banh mi, and it was just delightful. I woke up hungover and poor, so I decided on grubbing some pho on the way to the bank. The pho was nice, but the banh mi stole the show. Suck me sideways. Totally recommend this place.

I honestly really really love the place, it beats any Viet restaurant in LasVegas. If your a guy that needs quiet a bit of food to be filled up this is the place and I'll give you my order. Probably came here 1-2 times a week lol 

Good enough for 2 people. 
$15-20 per person 

Drink - 
Ice water 
Coconut water 

Start 
Fresh spring rolls 

Entree 
Beef Pho 
(Amazing make sure you include spices etc)

Secret menu ( this is what makes this place epic)
Side of steam rice
Slice of beef - $1 - sides/ extras 
Most amazing piece of meat get x5 

5Star meal right there. 

Then top it of with desert or a ice cream from Vons next door

Stopped in after a night of drinking with my friends. We were seated & waited on immediately, and I was impressed by the wide variety of options on the menu. I went with the #11, which was a plain ol' bowl of broth with flank as my choice of meat. The others paired their pho with a sandwich (which I regret not doing. I had a bite of my boyfriend's. So yummy!)

Anyway, I can definitely see myself returning some time soon. Maybe next time I'll be a little more adventurous with my tastebuds.
Phenomenal food!! Had the beef ribs and it was cooked and seasoned to perfection!!! Really glad we found this place

I had the chicken sandwich here. I thought it was very good and the price was very fair. I was open to eating just about anything on the menu, but being so close to the university sometimes can be pricy. So I was mainly there snooping.
The dining area was very clean and the staff was attentive, not annoyingly so. It was quick too and the price was right $3.50..
Fantastic broth, wonderful service and very very clean kitchen. Staff is happy and enthusiastic.

Honestly one of the worst Pho's I've had food and service! 
Compare to the Pho's I've had in Orange County this place is far below average.
The broth was very bland and the noodles were over cooked I couldn't really pick up the noodles without breaking. 
And the servers just had a plain poor attitude 
Very disappointed
Good customer service but taste has gone downhill. Iceberg lettuce in pho? Strange aftertaste too.

Nice little find on the corner of Tropicana and Maryland parkway. I've been here many times and always walk away satisfied. Really tasty Pho with many meats and veggies to choose from. Several different bahn mi sandwiches plus many other tasty dishes. My favorite is the marinated pork bahn mi with extra meat and add extra basil, sprouts and fresh jalapenos. That's how I roll there! Speaking of rolls, grab an extra roll (they're good) to go with a steaming bowl of Pho and you'll be a happy person. Bon Appetit!

I stopped into Thanh Huong for some lunch before class since I had some time to spare. I was the only one there, the service was great, the cashier at the front rang me up and made my sandwich in less than 5 minutes. Kudos to him. 
HOWEVER...He shouldn't have had to do that ...there were 2 other employees on the side of the restaurant hanging out. 

The restaurant is pretty spacious and very clean. I got the chicken and pate sandwich which was decent for $3.50. The fillings were great but what makes a good vietnamese sandwich is the bread. I found the bread to be too crumbly...I ended up with crumbs all over me lol. They should think about converting to baguettes like most Vietnamese sandwich shops have...it is easier to eat. 

The place is decent for a quick bite before class...but I'd probably go to Mr. Sandwich once that opens by UNLV if I'm craving Vietnamese sandwiches.

All my sons doctors are right by this restaurant, so every time I'm in the area I stop by for some phö ga. Some of the best phö I've ever had and love the staff! I guess you can say I'm a regular. Wouldn't want to eat phö anywhere else honestly.

Pleasant little store front Pho shop in a sketchy LV strip mall, but aren't most Las Vegas strip malls sketchy?  New to Pho, wish the young server would take more time to explain everything. Served a platter of bean sprouts and basil before the meal came, but had no idea what to do with them.  Also wish they served beer.  Had the vegetable and tofu pho which was very tasty but skimpy on the tofu. I enjoyed the meal and it seems other diners did as well.
Surprisingly good bowl of pho. Authentic and good service. Will be back to try their sandwiches next time.

I have taken the Pho Beef Noodle Soup for several times,  which named Pho Ga, its noodle is thin and long smooth strips with some fresh chicken and vegetables like bean sprouts, the soup is hot but tastes fresh and salty. Another one I would like to recommend is Chim Cut Chien which is fried quail. The skin of fried quail is crispy, but the meat inside is smooth and tender. And it tastes sweet and salty which is warm and delicious. That is a nice restaurant.
Perfect location,  good costumer service,  great food and reasonable prices.  I had the grilled chicken sandwich (3.50$) really good filling sandwich

Okay I take everything back I wrote in my last review. That review was based on years of eating there and suddenly everything changes.  First I walk up to the doors and there are pictures of food in the window which weren't there before. Then the inside was painted a different color. I looked at the menu at the to go counter and it was actually missing essential Vietnamese items like pho and vermicelli. The staff was also entirely different than the family that used to run the restaurant. So after I ordered my sandwich and I ask if there is a different owner. And the gal responds "Yes, different owner." UHH OHH! I ordered my usual charred pork bahn mi. I immediately noticed the bread was still the same, but the daikon radish was definitely different. More of a vinegar taste vs the mayonnaise taste, totally didn't like it. They also added cucumbers which the previous owners didn't do. Overall I think this place is on the wrong path. I will definitely come back to give them another chance, hopefully better changes will be implemented.

They have the BEST Vietnamese sandwiches in Las Vegas. Hands down.

I've been to many Vietnamese restaurants that specialize in banh mi sandwiches, and this restaurant has perfected it. The bread is crunchy/flakey on the outside and soft/chewy on the inside. And they are very generous with the pickled veggies and various meats too. 

Best of all, they are cheap, only $3.25+tax for any banh mi sandwich and they are located across the street from UNLV. I recommend the classic grilled pork banh mi.

Love this place, I always walk over here for lunch from UNLV and it's a much better value and healthier option than a lot of other places around here. As many others have said, the #57 banh mi is delicious!
The BEST egg rolls, Vietnamese ice coffee, & Vietnamese sandwiches in town!! We order large party trays of egg rolls for many of our parties! Our guests always love them!!
Wen there for dinner around 8ish and got a table for three right away.  Pho and com Thit nuong were good.  Two bowl of pho and one rice plate cost about $32.  Friendly service and fast.

I visit Las Vegas at least once a year and Thanh Huong is the first place I think of when losing that big bet on the blackjack table. The food is extremely cheap and delicious. The staffs are very friendly and the service is unbeatable. However; the food takes quite a while to arrive to the table, but that's always a good sign for me because I know that my favorite dishes are being cooked instead of microwave.

Dont let the name fool you. They may be called Pho Thanh Huong, but they sell a lot more then just Pho. They have from Vietnamese/French style sandwiches to many authentic dishes. Water and tea are free, but I highly recommend the milk coffee with bubba tea.

Our family loves pho! We wanted to try this place while visiting Vegas and for the price it was pretty decent! We got the brisket/flank pho and the veggies and tofu pho. I thought it had nice flavor and the veggies were plentiful. 

Yelp has this business closing at 9 pm but the sign on the door says open till 10 - so keep that in mind. 

We left with full bellies and empty bowls and for that, we thank you!

wow, as often as I come here, the mother and son team know us and what we like as soon as we come walking in.  I've gotten to know the mom that owns the place pretty well- she is a very nice lady but it helps to be pretty fluent in Vietnamese.

What can I say about the place- it has no atmosphere and the service is quite lacking but she makes one hell of a banh cuon.  If you don't know what banh cuon is, its rice rolls filled with ground pork, a type of fungi and seasonings...each roll is hand rolled..why do I know this? My mom makes some of the best in San Francisco...so when I come here and am craving my mom's banh cuon, this is pretty darn close.  They come out warm and gooey on a plate with bean spouts, cha lua ( vietnamese sausage) and veggies....

That is what brings me back again and again...and their sandwiches are pretty darn good too...their Pho is a hit or miss and some days I feel like I'm back home at my parents house when the kitchen and wait staff are yelling at each other...but oh well- I come for the food, not the service!
Prompt service, clean restaurant, great wait staff...excellent Pho and Fresh Spring Rolls

I don't normally go to Pho places but after trying Vietnamese sandwiches more often in the past month i decided to come here. The only other place i've had a Vietnamese sandwich was a place on Spring Mountain and all I can say about that experience is, well meh.

My family felt like getting some pho, but i didn't and felt like a sandwich so i chose to come to this restaurant as I knew they had the sandwiches but never tried them. I ordered 2 Grilled pork subs. When i saw them being handed to me, I smiled. They were bigger, Looked more fresh, and after tasting it, it tasted a whole bunch better than my previous experience. 

All i can say is that as of now, This place has the best vietnamese sandwiches i've tasted. And for less than 4 dollars it's a great deal.

Service could be a little better. The People working there look like students attending UNLV. It doesn't matter the age, but I just think service was just meh. Definitely come check it out.

I've been to this place plenty of times because it is near my house. I wanted to give the place 3 1/2 because it really isn't that fancy of a place but I rounded up.

There's plenty of seating, something I always enjoy. They let you sit wherever. Most of the seating is built for larger parties, so if it's just 1 or 2 people, you might feel bad taking up a whole top. Don't worry, I've never seen it get super packed.

The Pho is what I get here. I usually just get the Pho with Rare and Flank steak. It's always been pretty good for me. You can get a baked french roll for 50 cents with was a nice addition to the Pho. The Thai tea was also pretty delicious.

The service is nice. It always feels like a bunch of high school kids working there, but there are pretty attentive and nice. Always looking to refill the water in your cup.

While the Pho has always been pretty good, I do have to say I can't vouch for the other food. One time I got a sandwich there, some rib sandwich. I did bite into it and I hit a bone in the meat. Why the hell there was a bone in meat in a sandwich is beyond me, but that was the only time I ever had an issue. I'm just so big into Pho there, I don't bother with anything else. 

I think this place is worth a shot for people. They updated their menus so it looks much cleaner. They keep the place looking pretty nice. The staff is attentive and nice. The food is good. It's a nice Pho place.

As a connoisseur of pho on the west coast, I have eaten some great pho. This place has some great pho. My husband and I have eaten at several places since we moved to Vegas in November and this has been the best place so far. They have actual veggie broth and it's flavorful with a wide selection of veggies and tofu. The staff is very friendly and the prices are great. We are here every week!

This is a sandwich review. The rest of the menu looks a little too pricey anyway.

This summer, Las Vegas Weekly named the banh mi thit cha as one of the top 10 sandwiches in Vegas. They are dead wrong. The banh mi thit nuong is way better.

Both banh mi thit (please spell it correctly) are $3.25 and both come in a small baguette with pickled carrots and daikon, hot peppers (note from tongue to self: make sure they remove this next time!), and a bunch of some kinda butter or margarine flavor enhancer. The difference is that thit nuong is grilled pork. It has sweetness and all the pork flavor you would expect. The ham, steamed pork, and pate in the banh mi thit cha is all too mild in flavor. Top 10 in Vegas? It might only be top 10 on the restaurant's menu because there's only 10 sandwiches.

Get the banh mi thit nuong. It's not as good as banh mi thit I've had in San Jose, but it'll do for Vegas. Or you might try the banh mi trung chien lap xuong, which I've gotta have next time. Fried eggs with (sweet) chinese sausage? Count me in.

Service: 1 star, super slow service, gave us straws but our water didn't come out until after we finished our meal and reminded them about it, another table that came after us got their bowl of pho first (we had the exact same order), had to wait over 20-25 minutes for food to come out, had to wait another 7 minutes (reminded them 2x) after pho was served to get small bowls (never got the scissors ) for kids even after we specified this while ordering. Even with all the bad service, not once did they apologize. 

Pho: 1 star, broth didn't have much beef taste to it, only a few pieces of meat in the bowl, not much noodles either, had to order another entree to be full due to the small pho bowl. 

Rice with pork chops: 4 stars, among the various entrees we got, this is the only thing worth ordering again if I ever go back. Though I think my family will rather wait in line at Chinatown next time. 

Price: 1 star, overpriced for what we got. 

Overall, 2 stars. Most likely won't be coming back.

Ehhhh...

While service was awesome and accommodating, the food was a definite miss.

Ordered the veggie & tofu pho, added chicken, and switched beef to pork broth--a recommendation from the server. But the soup just didn't do it for me. The downer-side was the broth, I think. It tasted sweet and fishy towards the bottom. 

Maybe this is how their pork broth is served but it kinda killed my appetite because it wasn't anything I expected. 

Nevertheless, the fixings we a great amount and there we various veggie in my bowl to make me happy. 

Next time I'll have to try their sandwiches. I've been told they're one of the best in town.

Ok normally I go up a star when giving a half rating! But this time I'm going down just to the blasé attitude of everyone there!! Would have been 3 stars but food just wasn't good! I've been here before and had there sandwiches and pho, the sandwiches are always up to par!! With the crispy flaky bread& slaw ( the BBQ pork was my fave) but i probably won't be back after my last visit! Ordered the pho, had flank steak, tendon, beef? And tripe, ordered with no tripe! And got some funky meatball concoction! Also had more tripe and tendon than any other meat!! Of course no one checked back! We had ordered crispy spring rolls and sent those back as an appetizer, they were cold and not fried when we ordered the fried, the waitress who barely spoke English took them back, and the people behind the counter ate them in full view of us!! With there rubber gloves on, than proceeded to make the next persons sandwich with the same gloves on!! Poor guy!! Well when they came out they were microwaved and more chewy than crispy!! Double gross! Also the pho came out lukewarm and meat even tho thinly sliced took awhile to cook in broth!! Speaking of the broth it was very tangy and gosh I really don't kno how to describe it, but was not up to par the way it used to be ( we joked that maybe we really pissed them off and well ...... The bathroom is in full view of dining and two employees did go before we got our pho, just saying!!) my friend tried adding soy sauce , hoisen sauce everything , but that weird flavor didn't go away and finally gave up ! He only maybe had 1/5 of it, if that, and gave up, me I ate the noodles, & what beef there was, but really couldn't get into the broth either! So I left it!! When paying we told them we didn't like it and if they wanted to , go look at the table and see what we left ,nothing was taken off the check, and no real apology was given! I think we even payed for the first spring rolls that were the waitress's mistake! For 2 people it was over 35$ so I know I got ripped, but I was angry at their in different attitude and in turn they lost a customer !! Not that u go there that often about every 6 or 7 weeks but this last time will definetly be my last !! Poor food , poor service , and over priced go to Chinatown and get some options of pho eateries!! Hope this helps!! 

UPDATE
I lowered it 1 star after reading some other reviews, cuz both my friend and I did get sick after eating there!! And also forgot to say,they have really started to skimp on the meat, in sandwiches, which I guess it wAs good cuz there was less to throw up!! Lol

I have eaten from here numerous times though I have only dined in once.  I worked near by for a while and usually placed my order for take-out.  Given the in and out nature of my usual visits, to speak of poor service as others have would be irresponsible of me.  Instead I will rate the food and nothing more.  

I always get the same menu item when I go.  It is not pho.  It is not bahn mi.  I don't know the name of the dish I get but I can tell you it is my favorite.  Rice noodles with grilled pork and shrimp, peanuts, lettuce, a salad of carrot and daikon, and a spring roll.  It has always been good.  The pork is tender and flavorful.  The shrimp is not overcooked.  The spring roll was hot enough to scorch my mouth last time I went.  It is always crispy and flakey.  I crave it some times.  In fact, I'm kind of craving it now.  I have had the same dish else where and it was good there too.  When it comes to Pho Thanh Huong though, it is the original for me.  It is where I choose to eat when I need a good noodle fix on the go.
Still amazing, and the interior has gotten really nice.  we come here probably once a month if not more often ..

This is definitely a gemstone! They are serious about their foods! My favorite is Banh Xeo. It's by far the best Vietnamese crepe I've eaten. It far surpassed the ones in Westminster California. They make it big and put many things on it such as shreded squid/octopus (?), pork belly, yellow beans, bean sprouts, etc.. U guys definitely should try this one!

We came in a big group and tried several different plates.  All had excellent flavor and were reasonably charged. My only complaint was that they ran out of Bobba. I'd definitely go back again when I'm in Vegas.

Pretty good food and friendly staff. I docked them a star because of the location. BUT YOU GET TWO FREE EGG ROLLS WHEN YOU MENTION YELP. The Pho was excellent as were both the spring and egg rolls. While I did not try the sandwiches, by sight they seemed to be very good, I was shocked at their very low price. 

So if you're looking for a good friendly meal and you're in the area, give them a try. BTW, it seemed like the local Vietnamese people like it. At least I assume that was the language of about half the clientele.

Love the Pho here, however, 3 stars due to old and unappetizing  bean sprouts, mint/basil leafage and mutilated hot peppers. We have been to vast amount of Pho restr. in the area and this is actually the worst we have seen. (NOT TRYING TO BE NIT-PICKING AS THE PHO BROTH IS THE BEST)

We stopped by here since we were dropping people off at the airport, and we are always looking for good Pho and Vietnamese sandwiches. Very friendly people working and fast service, noticed first off the place is clean and bright. Wifey had the Chicken with Clear Noodles, which was great. I had the Grilled Beef Sand, it was fantastic. The French roll tasted like it was baked this morning. Great place and recommend.

I skipped this place on more than one occasion for two reasons: it's too close to my house (any excuse to travel over to Spring Mountain to visit the Asian markets gets me rarin' to go) but also because it's in the Vons shopping plaza that inexplicably is sometimes packed to the hilt (it must be something over at UNLV, there's no way PT's or Dotty's is pulling them in like that!). Anyway, I went for pho and was satisfied. A large order of rare steak and brisket pho is only $6.99 and although I haven't tried them yet, their sandwiches look amazing (and seemed very popular with the many to-go customers buzzing in and out while I ate), and on top of that, they have dried shredded chicken available for sale which I proudly pointed out to my boyfriend in the hopes he'll stop making fun of the large container of pork-fu in my kitchen cabinet. 

Good value, great service, and CLEAN!

Typical Vietnamese place in the menu. Pho is outstanding and always have to stop here at least once when in town!  Service is always fast, place is clean, staff is friendly. 

Maybe someday ill try something else on their menu.

I have just passed by to get the 56 Banh Mi. And it tastes terrible not as usual. They used an ole stale loaf of bread to make this banh mi for me. Extremely chewy and I felt like I was eating cardboard paper. Disappointed!

I had a sore throat, so I needed to drown my head in some Pho.

This place is near my house and reliable. I have been here several times and I haven't had a bad experience there. Lately, it has even been better because it appears that they made new menus and cleaned the place a little better. 

The Pho is standard, I usually get rare steak and brisket in mine and load it up with all of the basil and Sriracha I can handle. This time, I also tried a Vietnamese bread roll. Super crispy on the outside and soft and fresh on the inside. Much like french bread which is no surprise as the French most likely introduced bread to the Vietnamese when they colonized them.

The staff are attentive and friendly. I never felt rushed in there and my water class was constantly refilled.

Think taking pics of menus don't matter? Think again! 
I owe a shout-out to fellow Yelper Cindy because if it wasn't for her clear menu pic, I wouldn't have found what I was looking for! Thank you!

One word: #68
Bahn Mi sandwiches are not hard to find in Vegas. But beef wrapped onion certainly is! I didn't discover until I moved to CA, and so far this is the only place  in Vegas that I have found has it. It is the juiciest, most flavorful and tender morsels of marinated flank steak rolled up with perfectly cooked onion slices inside. Honestly, I could just pull the wraps out and eat the veggie sandwich separately. And the price? A mere $5.00! Best value in town. 

I have been lunching here for years- on the usual suspects- pho tai, fresh spring rolls and such. Menu is large, service is great, ambiance is casual and clean. Plenty of small tables that easily fit together for your large gatherings. Now I will be back much more often for my new favorite which may become yours! Long live bo hahn huong! Beef wrapped onion, that is. :) 
You can thank me later. Cheers!

I'm def a fan of this place!  Talk about good Banh Mi (Vietnamese sandwiches)!  Pork with pate is fantastic and a delicious side with a bowl of pho, too!  I also really like the pho here!  The food here is basic and stands up as delish!  

One time, the server seemed like he was super-disoriented and on something or just really out of it, but while it was a bit of a hassle to order, it was more just amusing than a detraction...  I still had my pork with pate crispy sandwich!  Good bubble tea, for what it is.

4.5 stars!!!

What this place lacks in decor and location it more than makes up for with great Vietnamese food and helpful service.

I came the 3 miles from my hotel to satisfy my yearning for noodle soup (after reading about this spot on Yelp). Even though I arrived after it was closing they served me my Mi Tom Cua (squid, prawn, crabstick and egg noodle) without complaints. Also they let me order a take-out pork sandwich. All for $12. 

I loved the fragrant tea so much I bought a pound of it too. Even though I only wanted 1/2lb I didn't make a fuss as the family was so nice.

Come here and try the beef pho (i don't eat much beef so I skipped it) as it looks like the best!
