Their pho is usually very good, however there was once that they served pho with very salty soup broth that tasted different than before. Sometimes when you come in to the restaurant there's some fishy smell.
Awesome grilled pork Bahn Mi, spring rolls and pho tai. This is my go to place when I'm feeling some Vietnamese food.

This place is wonderful. 
The staff is so friendly and I am never disappointed in the quality of food. 
My favorite is the #11 with everything! 
We come here maybe twice a week (or try to) since the prices are fantastic for their portions. 
If you're looking for good pho, come here. I'm so happy that we found this place!

This place is perfect on a hot summer day and after a long cross country drive.  The banh mi and the rice rolls definitely hit the spot after seeing hours of subway sandwich shops fr Canada to Cali.  Thank goodness for Pho Tranh!

Little hidden gem right next to UNLV. I really wanted to eat a sandwich before I went to UNLV to study and Yelp recommended this place! I would've never thought I would be able to find a Vietnamese restaurant on this side of town. 

Right when I walked in there was a cart full of fresh baguettes!!! I was so happy I called in and order a bahn mi. The smell alone made me hungry. The bahn mi was around $5 and it was bugger than a 6" at Subway. 

As much as I wanted to down this bad boy, you know you cannot eat bahn mi's in the car.  FYI! The crunch of the baguette will dirty your car in an instant. Find a place, sit down, and let the flakes fly everywhere!! 

The meat was so good and the pickled cabbage was fresh. 

The parking is a bit sketchy but once you go inside it's clean and get a great welcome from the staff. The restaurant is definitely family owned as everyone was so nice. 

Check it out if you're near UNLV and is craving a Vietnamese sandwich!

Thank goodness I was craving pho today! I stopped by here with a couple of friends after two classes and enjoyed the pho and service very much! The cashier even gave us more discount on top of the UNLV student discount because we said we would be returning! He was funny and nice!

My wife and I come here often, but after today's experience, we might have to find another place for vietnamese food. The food is good and the prices are decent. However, the service here is a hit or miss, and lately it has been absolutely horrible. Our orders often come out incorrect or items are missed despite pointing to the item on the menu when ordering. At first, we thought it was because they are busy, but there weren't that many dinners tonight and this seems to be the norm based on our past few experiences here.

If you want really clean slightly Americanized Vietnamese this is the place for you. If you want that traditional dirty flavor, keep looking this isn't the place for you. If you have no idea what I mean by clean you haven't eaten at enough real Asian restaurants. The Pho broth tasted like it hadn't been boiled long enough and was missing something. It also came out warm, not pipping the way Pho should. The spring rolls were ok but nothing to write home about. The service was good. The soft drink selection is all cans but with lots of options.

I have been here several times and the food and service never disappoint. The broths are so fresh and full of flavor! This place is my favorite Pho restaurant, and will continute to be my son and myself's drewy day soup spot!

Stick with the sandwiches and the rice noodle dishes.  They are quite yummy.  

I don't eat pho (or other soup noodles) so I can't say anything about it here.

Wow! What a great find in a small, unassuming place. The Banh Mi sandwiches were GREAT, the spring rolls were GREAT and the Egg Rolls may be the best you've ever had! The service was spot on. Highly recommended!

I have never had Vietnamese sandwiches before and this seemed to be the place to go to try it. I was visiting from Chicago not too long ago and was happy to be able to get some authentic Vietnamese fare. I tried the #2 sandwich,cant remember exactly what it had but it was fresh, simple yet very tasty. I also tried the BBQ pork one on another day and was even more impressed. I love that their prices are very affordable. One of these sandwiches beats spending 5-7 dollars at subway any day!!

Oh an another plus, my friends and I who were traveling back to Chicago decided to pick a sandwich up for the plane ride. I ended up not eating it till after landing and the sandwich held up really well throughout the whole day!

Stopped for a quick lunch before heading out to the National Parks.  We had the rare beef pho, which was fantastic.  Great broth flavor and lots of meat.  We also had the grilled beef banh mi and the pork banh mi.  Both were very good, although I thought that the beef was a bit pricey.

Food came quick and the service was friendly.  If you're looking for good, solid Vietnamese food, you can't do too much better than this place!

The food is absolutely delicious, but the service is what's preventing me from coming back. We live in Summerlin and just to eat here, we'd take the drive. We haven't gone back for a week because the same thing always happens to us. One time we were seated and not given menus. When our orders are taken, the waitress clearly writes everything down, but somehow we end up with the wrong dishes? Last time we were here we ordered fried egg rolls that didn't come out for 25 minutes, but when we asked about them the girl was clueless and brought fresh spring rolls instead that were for the table next to us. My sister sat with her pork chop plate for 15 minutes without the fish sauce and utensils to eat. I was served my banh xeo plate without the fish sauce and utensils as well.

I decided to give this place a second chance. 
Usually I come here for their Bahn MI's as they are delicious, but I decided to try something different.

I got the fresh spring rolls and the combo vermicelli bowl with BBQ pork and egg rolls. 

I'm still dissapointed in the spring rolls. The ingredients are fresh but the pork itself is super dry and flavorless. I do like their peanut sauce, but I wish it was a little thicker as it's hard to use as a dipping sauce. 

I did like the vermicelli bowl, I am not a fan of shrimp, but I loved these ones as they seemed grilled and marinated. The pork was tender and had a delicious marinade, and the vermicelli freshly made. 

I however did not like the egg rolls. The texture on the inside was mushy and flavorless, and I wish in my vermicelli bowl that the fresh veggies were not under the warm vermicelli. 

But still their Bahn MI's are delicious
Drug test your employees/Owner... ordered to go/Take Out,  came to hotel to eat, ,. WTH all orders were Wrong.  FuK yu  NOT COMING BACK

Met a friend at Pho Thanh Huong who loves this place & is his go to place to grab a quick bite during his lunch break from work. I can see why. Clean, friendly service, good food. We ordered the egg rolls and the beef pho. 

The egg rolls were well made. They were crispy, had a good ratio of pork & veggie stuffing to-wrapper, and not too greasy or soggy at all. 

The pho was delicious and one of the  best I have tasted in Las Vegas so far. The broth was not too salty & had good flavor. The ratio amount of sliced beef, spring onions, and noodles was justifiable. The garnish toppings of Thai basil and bean stouts was fresh. I have had pho from other places were there was hardly any sliced beef, overloaded with noodles, and the broth was either too salty, flavorless or the garnish toppings were not crisp n fresh.

I will return to Pho Thanh Huong as I am a fan of banh mi (Vietnamese sandwiches) and I want to try those on my next visit. They looked delicious. 

I finally went back to Pho Thit Huong and tried the Banh Mi Nuong sandwich and it was better than I expected. Tasted way better than other Banh Mi sandwiches I've had in China town on Spring Mountain. The bread was crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. The pork meat was nicely seasoned and the pickled veggies were fresh and tangy! A nice size sandwich portion with plenty of meat for only $3.50!!! I elevate my 4 star rating to a 5 star rating! This will now be my go to place for Vietnamese cuisine!! Yum!

$3 with tax for a tofu banh mi...nuff said.  but seriously nice hot chillies, fresh bread, yummy carrot-daikon slaw...
on top of it, i am not a coffee drinker whatsoever, i am all about tea.  but when i need a pick-me-up, i get the vietnamese iced coffee with boba.  highly recommend.
Quick service, great prices, and spot on pho!  The food is southern vietnam style.  It is authentic.

3.5 stars, but I'll round up to 4 based on the sheer value near the strip. From the outside, this strip mall seems best to be avoided, but if you're looking for cheap eats, stop by for sure. When ordering their sandwiches, don't get fancy. Stick with the BBQ pork. The others are just okay. They also don't load them up with as many pickled veggies as other pho joints so it lacks some depth. Get a bowl of their 'built it yourself' pho and you get to pick exactly what goes in to it. I told them everything, and indeed I got all the 'adventurous' bits  :)  I'm happy I found this place. They usually have some UNLV student working here, so service is decent.
The best beef broth I've had in Vegas. Ordered their king size pho with beef, tendon, and brisket, and it did not disappoint! Love it!

I wish I had tried this place sooner. It's a quick drive through the airport tunnel from work and their Banh Mi is super cheap at only $3 per sandwich including tax (a couple of them cost slightly more). I went with the #1 Pork. At first, I was underwhelmed by how much was inside the bread. Then I realized that it's on par with other Vietnamese places; it's just that their bread is so huge. I'm actually impressed with the bread. At the ends where there is basically no filling, it's still delicious because the bread is so good. As for the filling, it was very tasty. They don't have a "Combination" Banh Mi option like other places, which is what I usually get, so it's hard to compare directly. However, the #1 Pork has actual chopped up chunks of pork with great flavor. Overall, a very satisfying sandwich for $3.

We just happened to notice the place on a walk while in town and decided to go here for lunch.  Absolutely delicious!  Can't beat the prices, quality, service, and cleanliness!  We shared a shrimp salad from the appetizer menu and each had a sandwich.  We'll be back!

I ordered some sandwiches and I told the person taking the order 3x NO freak'n mayo in my sammies.  Not once, not twice, but thrice.  WTF!!!  And yet again, I got sammies with mayo.  

The problem was not that I didn't repeat myself many times over, the problem was that she was on the phone talking to a family member.  Couldn't be bothered to excuse herself to take my order properly.  The one thing people cannot do is talk on the phone and take orders at the same time.  That's how you f#%$ up the orders!!!  Duh!!!!!

I was so pissed!!  Never again will I ever come back here!!!  They can get lost, better yet close down for all I care!!!
Not much flavor.  Awful service.  The food did not taste that great, I'll be on the look out for another Vietnamese restaurant.

I really enjoy the pho here and often get it to go for lunch when I'm in the area.The restaurant has upgraded inside and is more warm and welcoming than the plain white walls they had in the past.The people that work there are still very friendly and are more than happy to help answer any questions. They make fresh baguettes there daily, so the bahn mi sandwiches get extra yum points for freshness. 

What I like most about this restaurant is that they give plenty of fresh side fixings to go with the pho or noodle soups. Either for take out or dine in, they give lots of bean sprouts, Thai basil leaves, sliced jalepenos, and sliced lime. However, if you do want more chili sauce or hoisin sauce to go, just ask for it. Otherwise, you get one small container of each. The bun bo hue was decent. Not too spicy and had a decent amount of meat. The regular size pho was enough to split for two or one really hungry person. They do offer the King size pho for about 3 dollars more and that can feed 2 hungry people. Don't forget to order their Vietnamese iced coffee to keep the food coma at bay after eating!

Very good Vietnamese food in an area that is not typical. The service is always excellent. My co-workers and I come here for lunch a lot. We've always had our orders in a timely manner and all special requests have always been done correctly. We have no issues paying the Bill separately at the counter. The baguette bread for the sandwiches is a little softer than typical, but everything from egg rolls, sandwiches, pho, and grilled plates have been really tasty.

This place's service is so bad.  We waited more than 30 minutes for the pho until we decided to leave, and it's not even rush hour.  There were only 4 tables there.  It was our first time,  but for sure there won't be another.

I went here craving pho, and wanted something closer to home than my normal spot. This was a great choice as the pho broth was delicious and flavorful. They have everything you need on the table and they still check on you often. While the pho was amazing, the Thai tea impressed me. Perfect creaminess along with the flavor of Thai tea. Check out was easy because you don't even need to calculate a tip, they have it there for you when you slide your card.

I only come here when I am in the mood for banh mi, so I can't comment on anything else on the menu (but I've heard that the pho isn't that great).  The sandwiches are cheap and they taste fresh.  I have always taken my orders to go, so the cleanliness--or supposed lack thereof--hasn't bothered me.  This certainly isn't a place to go out for a weekend dinner, but it makes for a great lunch every once in a while.

Soooooo AMAZING! A party of 20 came before my party of 6 but we were greeted and take care of as equally fast. Food was amazingly good! My entire family kept saying, "Mmmmmmmm". We didn't stop eating until we were all too full that we felt we were going to explode or be rolled out. Haha!!

This place is AWESOME!

From the outside you can't tell how nice it is inside.

The service was excellent and they have a large selection on the menu.

I had the Goi Cuon Fresh Spring Rolls and Pho Dac Biet with Tai Rare Beef and Bo Vien Meatballs and it was excellent.

Those were some of the best Fresh Spring Rolls I've had.

I totally recommend this place!

That time you go to a pho restaurant with a craving, and leave wanting pho. 

Yelp really let me down here. No way this place is 4/5.  Also, the Yelp check in coupon isn't accepted anymore.  There was a strange smell permeating throughout the empty restaurant. 

I got the Pho Dac Biet, best way to judge a pho restaurant. Broth had a mild flavor, there was one or two pieces of each type of meat, and there was a moderate amount of noodles to mask the lack of substance to the bowl.  Thoroughly unsatisfying. 

We also got a sandwich, which was made with yesterday's bread. I know when you do sandwiches to go, they're not super warm.  However, our sandwich came out cold. Danggggggggg, that's saying to me "we're not even trying."  The sandwich itself was alright  once it warmed up in my mouth. 

The prices were okay, but there's too many nearby restaurants that actual try and are more deserving of your patronage.

Great banh mi and iced Thai tea. Bread is baked onsite and had just the right crunchiness on the outside while remaining soft inside. Location is convenient to LAS and not that far away from the strip. Simple setting, great food, friendly staff and excellent prices. Perfect for a quick meal.
Accomodated our large party easily. Decent Vietnamese food not too far from The Strip.

*They give a discount to UNLV students with valid ID card*

I enjoyed this place because you can actually create your own Pho. #11. Pho Dac Biet. You get to choose from:

1.) Tai Rare
2.) Nam Flank
3.) Chin Brisket
4.) Bo Vien Meatballs
5.) Sach Tripe
6.) Gan Tendon

You can select all the meats you would like without any extra costs. I like this idea because I usually order a combination pho and catch myself picking out the tripe and tendon. 

I have to say the Grilled Chicken Banh Mi was the best Banh Mi I've had in town! The bread was amazing and is a properly made French baguette. It is a must try!

*You also get a free egg roll if you mention Yelp*

We stopped at Pho Thanh Huong for lunch on our way to LAS. Found it on Yelp and thought if the Yelp foodies like it, and so do the UNLV foodies, then this foodie should like it too. Thankfully I was right as usual. 

We ordered a feast. I mean, how can you not? Everything looks so good. Did I mention it's so cheap too? I started with the Tra Thai Tran Chau (Thai Tea with boba) which was wonderful and a flavorful tea with lots of chewy boba. For lunch I started with the Banh Mi Thit Cha, which hit the spot. A traditional bahn mi sandwich with wonderfully fresh french bread, yummy pork, head cheese, and spicy jalapeno. For just $4.50 it was quite the bargain. I followed up with a huge bowl of Pho...and oh was it tasty. The beef was sliced super thin and cooked for just an instant in the hot rich broth, it just melted in my mouth. Of course not the most amazing pho I have ever had, but it hit the spot nonetheless. 

I have now added Pho Thanh Huong to my short list of on-the-way-to-LAS must hit lunch spots.

I haven't been back to Pho Thanh Huong since I moved to the southwest area 5 years ago. Since I was in the mood for Pho and couldn't find any good Pho in the chinatown/west part of town. I yelped and saw a couple posting about PTH.

Anyway, a bunch of my family members came back over the week and tried different things and here what we found:

- Pho is similar to other places I found on the west side of town. The broth is below average and  tasted just like someone dipped a pho flavor bag into hot water. It has no natural sweetness at all.

- Bun thit nuong (grill pork vermicelli (not sure if this is correct spelling but too lazy now to look it up) was good.

-  Except soda that came in a can, all their specially made drinks weren't good.

- The best thing I found at this place is their grill pork sandwich. It was very very good. I would drive all the way here just for this sandwich.

By the way, some yelpers mentioned about the weird smell of this place, which I experienced while I was there. It has that stale cigarette smell that you normally experience when visit really old casino.

If you're looking for a big delicious bowl of pho, look no further. And when I say big I mean it. Their bowls are huge! And at small price tag. I was definitely a fan of this place. Their broth was perfect. Meat and noodle ratio was spot on. Although I could barely put a dent in my bowl, I savored each and every bite. 

My gfs got the vermicelli and a banh mi and they were all fans. The shrimp in the vermicelli were huge! I couldn't believe it. Despite everything being big in portions, when we ordered an iced coffee my cup was filled completely with ice. There was probably 2 big gulps in there. What a rip! Luckily it was tasty and the hot Vegas weather melted my ice rather quickly so I got a little more out of it. 

Only complaint is that service is a  little slow. But a okay, I know how to behave in an Asian restaurant. It's about hailing them down for yourself!

Heard Banh Mi (Sandwiches) were good but didn't try them. We had instead #29 Com Tam Suong Nuong (the Seared Pork Chop with broken rice) which was pretty good but the fish cake was kind of bland. Pho Dac Biet (House special Pho) was in a gigantic bowl. I was impressed by the portion size. It fed my brother's craving for pho and he was full all day. Service was good, the tables were load out with plenty of space. The only other note is the weird smell the place had when we first came in. Other than that not a bad place for a Viet restaurant that's not in Chinatown Vegas.

On a quick three night trip to Vegas and tired of strip food. So off to yelp for something different. Wow did we find different. Would have never walked through the doors of this place but all the great reviews made us take a chance. Sure glad we did. The wife got the PHO I got some beef and shrimp plate over rice and egg rolls. Everything was amazing. We will definitely be eating here on are next trip to Vegas. It's in a very sketchy strip mall. But once inside it is very clean and neat. The prices are low for the amount of food you get.

I never waited for an order of pho for so long. Was picking up Togo and ordered a pho Dac biet and young coconut. Waited for 30 mins to get my coconut and 40 mins for my pho. Which was only given to me when I asked for a refund...so disappointed. Made me late for an event that I had at 7 and was thinking to grab a quick bite before it. Don't come here if you want fast pho. Usually within 40 mins I would've been seated ordered and finished eating by the time I got my pho today. Will not recommend this place
Everything was delicious! We tried the "create your own Pho combo", sandwiches, and rice combos #27 and 28. My family loved everything! The service was also great!
Definitely enjoyed the grilled chicken sandwich. Coming back for sure.

This was my first time here and I had a pretty good experience.  I met a friend for lunch because she said she loves the sandwiches here.  I haven't eaten a lot of bahn mi since moving to Vegas, and I really like them so I was excited to give this place a try.  Since I've been making pho at home for every meal I eat in, I wasn't about to order their pho.  THAT would just be pho-king extreme.

I ordered the spring rolls and #57, which I think was steamed pork and pate.  Can I just say, YUMMY IN MY TUMMY!!!  The spring rolls could've used a little more meat and shrimp, but it was still really good.  It wasn't dry and rubbery like some spring rolls tend to be when it's not fresh.  My sandwich was so delicious. The bread is impossibly crispy and soft at the same time, and the fillings were ample.  I loved the subtle sweetness in the mayo that they use here as well.  If I am craving bahn mi, I will definitely stop here. For a mere 3 bucks a pop, sign me up!

One negative is that the server never came back to refill my water even though it was sitting on the edge of the table empty for nearly the entire meal.  Just don't expect too much out of the service here, but again, 3 bucks a pop!

I ate here as I am wanting to have the top 10 sandwiches as decided by Las Vegas Weekly.  So, I had the banh mi thit cha.  The bread was super fresh and crusty.  The ingredients were all very fresh, but I found myself wanting more vegetables, which is something given that I am a huge carnivore.  They add an awesome crunch.  The sandwich was very good, and as most note, a great deal at less than $4.  I also had egg rolls, which were standard.  I will say they brought my sandwich out at least 7 minutes before the egg rolls.  I understand they take longer to cook, but I would have preferred everything being brought out at once.   I will likely return, the staff was friendly and it was a comfortable place.
Great pho, small restaurant with good service. No negatives from me but at the same time nothing that stood out as amazing.

Like I said, I knew I would be back to try their Banh Mi (Vietnamese sandwiches) on my next flight out.  The BF and I grabbed three sandwiches to share and what a great deal it was.

They have their own ovens back there to bake their own French bread, which makes these sandwiches even more ideal!  We got the recommended #1 Grilled Pork (Banh mi Thit Nuong) with pate added as well as the #13 Grilled Chicken with Pate (Banh mi Pate Ga).

Both sandwiches were so good, great flavor and a nice heat from the jalapenos.  

What a steal for three sandwiches for $10!  Definitely the place to go to grab some banh mi for the road!

Update! (09/02/10)

Stick to the sandwiches and maybe the pho - don't try the Hainan chicken rice dish.  It was VERY dry, probably among the worst I've had!  It was old and definitely not something theyspecialize in!

I had the grilled pork sandwich it was good but I don't think top 10 good. I also had the egg rolls which was bland in comparison to Da Lat's egg rolls. The dipping sauce for the egg rolls was pretty bland as well. It was extremely hot in the restaurant as if there was no AC. Overall food was alright but did not meet up to the hype of being top ten in sandwiches.
Pho is alright. Free egg rolls and bahn mi are pretty good especially for the price! Service lacks greatly, didn't get greeted when sat down or any other form of interaction throughout the meal.
Near UNLV  and the strip this place is local spot !!! Great food their Pork banh mi is super delicious their bread is fresh!!! My favorite

This place is the perfect location to go if you're looking for a meal close to the airport and is slightly crunched on time. I dropped a friend off at the airport and grabbed dinner here before hand. Food comes out quickly, service is fast, and it's only a 5 min drive to the terminals. 

My friend got the pho dac biet and I got a banh mi with Vietnamese deli meats. The pho broth was flavorful. I feel like this is not one of those msg free establishments though. The meat portion was generous and the noodles were slightly aldente. 

My sandwich was good. The baguette was nice and soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. They were generous with the pate which is my favorite part. There was a good meat to veggie balance.
Delicious Pho, we came here based off the reviews. Everything was very fresh , even the coconut drink we had was as well.

Where have I been ? Before pho t this was the closest to me yet I would still drive to Chinatown when I wanted some pho. I have no idea why because this place is pretty damn good. I came by myself on a Friday after trying to decide what I wanted to eat in the UNLV area and ultimately ended trying to figure out where to go and just said eff it. I love pho why not ?! 

They greet you upon entering and tell You to seat yourself then bring water and menus immediately. Thanks for the fast service ! 

I went for rare steak pho and a Bahn mi with charbroiled pork. 
 

The pho was piping hot and flavorful. Initially after tasting I told myself the broth was missing something. Maybe it could be a little more flavorful. Then it hit me duh it's missing lime ! After that it was A Ok ! Not my favorite broth I've tried but the fact that they gave a huge amount of noodles and meat made up for it. They definitely are not stingy with Portion at $8.50 a bowl. The Bahn mi came out with the pho. Crusty baguette bread loaded with meat and vegetable. I did enjoy the Bahn mi but I'd have to say I would have enjoyed more vegetables on it. 

After eating that delicious pho I only took a few bites of the Bahn mi and took it to go and enjoyed it later. Still good it's just better to eat it fresh when the bread it's till warm and toasty. 

Definitely worth trying. Next time I'll try a bubble drink ;) and have my pho fix !

One star just because their banh mi suck now. They switched ppl like 8 months ago and it was a guy who used to make them now it's a girl. Skimpy on the meat, skimpy on the veggies, tastes like cardboard because of not enough spread. Don't bother asking for extra it costs a dollar. For literally 2 cents of veggies. That is almost a 30% increase in price.  Still can't beat the 3.50 though but terribly disappointing slide in quality of food. Pho is alright. tastes like it's got msg in it, gives my wife and I a headache so we always go for the banh mi here. Usually good service. We used to come here 4-5x each month. Hopefully management reviews this page and implements some quality control. Check out the unappetizing photos. Really hope they taste better soon.

- edit : have since returned, bang mi quality control has improved somewhat and they still have fairly quick service. Good to grab as a to go item and sometimes I get one before hopping on a plane. Otherwise the pho is fairly decent.

I know where I'm going when I have my next banh mi craving! Finally, a place that meets my expectations. Fresh tasting crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside bread, well seasoned and good portioned meat, and perfectly pickled veggies. My go to sandwich is the grilled pork banh mi ($3.25). I've tried the pricier ones like the lemongrass beef banh mi, which was good, but was not worth the price. Very friendly service and my order was complete in less than 10 minutes.  I'll have to try the pho next time! 

*****Yelp 2016 100 challenge*****
17/100

I'm writing this review for the only two things I order at this joint, which is their grilled pork banh mi and their broken rice special combo plate. Both are YUMMEEHHH!

I love the combo plate because they do NOT skimp on your meat. It comes with all the delicious stuff on it, with scrumptious nuoc cham on the side, and generous cucumber and tomato. The rice is plentiful, the meat is tasty. The sandwich had deliciously light, crisp bread and they are reasonably generous with the meat. I've had "the real deals" out in California so it's kind of hard to put them on the same pedestal, but as far as Vegas is concerned, they are pretty damn good. I love the avocado shake too- thick, not too sweet, with good boba. It was a nice cap to the meal.

The store smells like smoke, which was a big turn off right when you walk in. Other than that, the bahn mi is pretty good and cheap. Yummm :) I really like the bahn mi with fried eggs and Chinese sausage. The staff do their job and that's about it. There's no special assistance or work on their end. But at least what needs to be done gets done. Except for this one time I went with a group and nobody came to refill water. Sad. It's not award-winning food or service here, but it definitely will satisfy me when I'm broke and I want a good bahn mi. That's the only food I go to this place for.

Great tasting French Vietnamese sandwiches at rock bottom prices.

The pho is not bad either (well just stay away from the blood cake unless you like that sort of thing.)  

Service can be a little strange.  You order and they let you know when your food is ready...sometimes.  Sometimes, it just sits on the counter and everyone just disappears into the kitchen. Kinda funny.

Highly recommended if you're by UNLV and needing an inexpensive but good meal.
The pho broth tastes like watered down chicken broth from  a can.  Very disappointing.  The rice dishes are a little better.

When I lived in California, pho was always one of my favorite rainy day foods because of the warm, comforting feeling I would get after eating a huge bowl of it. On one of those rare rainy days here in Vegas, I began to feel a little homesick and decided to try this restaurant. 

Upon walking in I was greeted by the friendly staff which automatically gave this place a couple stars. Customer service is a big part of my dining experience at any restaurant, and this place definitely meets my expectations. I decided to get a bowl of pho with brisket and sliced beef. My order came out quickly and was bigger than I had expected. The broth has a very good flavor and tastes even better with the addition of the bean sprouts, lime juice, and basil leaves. The meat was very tasty and plentiful as well. 

When I went to the counter to pay my check, I discovered that the huge bowl of pho was only $8.50! The only thing I love besides good food is cheap food. I will definitely be coming back here to satisfy my random pho cravings.

everytime my honey and i are in vegas we both love to visit this pho thanh huong spot, the food is good. leaving aside the man with the bad eye, they have this excellent broth, fresh herbal woogie platters, plentiful mean, enough noodles. if you decide to visit try the banh mi its a complete treat.
This restaurant has the best tofu spring rolls I have ever tasted. Whether with the peanut sauce or the sweet and sour sauce, they are incredibly delicious and definitely worth a try!

The best pho in town. I am from Sweden - living in Vegas for the last 4 years. Every time kids fly in the first place they want to go is here. Don't order a large pho - it is huge. Avocado boba and 5 bucks of BBQ meat side order is an amazing add on to an already fantastic pho. 5 stars any day.

This is where you come when you're not in the mood for fast food, frozen pizza from Vons, or would prefer not to drive across town for tasty Vietnamese food.  

Now allow me to say that I am no expert on Vietnamese food, but I will say is that I'm pretty confident when I say that this is a quality establishment. 

I stopped by here on the eve of Thanksgiving and was seated immediately. After perusing the menu V decided to order to order Com chien thap can fried  rice with Vietnamese ham and Chinese sausages along with fried fish balls as my appetizer.

My meal was more than adequate and quite tasty to boot! My total bill before the gratuity was around $14.00

The bread here has the perfect amount of fluffiness and crunch! I have tried their banh mi several times and the ingredients are always fresh. They use the good soy sauce on the bread. I usually order grilled pork or the cold cut banh mi. My person likes the egg sunshine (egg & Chinese sausage) and/or the sardine banh mi. The thing to do is order extra sandwiches to take home for lunch the next day. Or for a snack later. 

The sandwiches are better than those served at most places in Chinatown. If this place were closer to my home/work I would probably go several times a week.

Service is quick and attentive. The servers and hostess are kind and accommodating to even our odd requests. They're on the younger side, perhaps UNLV students? Let's tip them well!

This place has bread, and yes, I mean the literal kind that comes in loaves. The bread is a magical combination of crusty, crunchy and soft all at the same time. How do they do that? Definitely magic. This element pretty much guarantees they are going to have a good banh mi, and that is exactly what they have. 

I like it, but I do not absolutely love it. The bread is so delightful they should make it a foot long! Alas, the sandwiches are a little small. They offer a tofu option, which I appreciate, but their tofu filling is not especially flavorful. It tastes like tofu, not necessarily bad, but not miraculous. They could spice that bean curd up a bit.

As for the pho, I would describe it as good, not flavorless, but also not the best. Plus, they aren't able to serve up a vegetable filled pho, which as you may know is my standard for judging pho places.

Lastly, the service has always been haphazard when we have visited. The last time they were out of jalapenos. What? And, it was unclear if there was really a waiter in the dining area, as no one consistently checked in with us and it took a while for our food to come out. Plus, their menu pricing and what they charge doesn't seem to be the same. We have been confused by our bill on both occasions. Be sure to double check your bill if you go! 

In conclusion, the bread is their secret sauce.

I love pho :]
as much as I love my BF..
or more maybe.

Within the past five years that I have been an occasional customer I have never experienced any issues with this place. Each time I went in they were slow, which is a big plus for me because food comes out faster that way. I always ordered their chicken pho and asked for white meat only. It's a mix with white and dark meat so if you're not a fan of either the two you could just let your server know, and they'll leave it off. Their bahn mi and egg rolls are super good and affordable! I think this is a very good and convenient pho spot besides traveling to China town. Average price for two pho's and a spring roll would be roughly around $26-$28 with tax. 

Also, careful around the restaurant. There's a lot of solicitors there, they come in and talk to the customers and some of the servers ask them to leave but the others don't interfere as much. You'd have to shoo some people away while you're trying to eat LOL

I stopped at this place for lunch every chance I get. Close to the airport and next to the Las Vegas strip. Every time, my regular go to is the Vietnamese egg-rolls and Pho special. And always take to go is the sandwich for later. This place have not failed me yet with the foods. Portion is large and the price is reasonable.The restaurant is nice and clean, friendly staff and plenty of parking. Definitely will visit again.

After making the rounds to various Banh mi shops all over town, this is by far my favorite !!! Being a 9-5er in the Spring Mountain area it pains me that none of the ones in the Spring Mountain area can live up to this place, but it's true. Yup, you must leave Chinatown to get your Vietnamese  sandwich fix!

This is one of my favorite spots to grab a bite to eat. I love that they are very accommodating to my vegan diet. They were willing to substitute grilled tofu instead of pork for the vermicelli noodles as well as a yummy banh mi sandwich. I also loved that they actually flavored my tofu with taste like a garlic, sesame, soy sauce. My husband loves the huge bowl of pho in coconut milk and spices. I order the side dish of noodles and side dish of soup for my kids to share (it is huge). Only think my kids were not too fond of was the meatballs. Very tough texture and not appetizing to my husband and kids. All-in-all this is a favorite spot.

I am a HUGE Fan of Vietnamese Food and have had the opportunity to hit Vietnam several times for holiday. The food here is Delicious! Please start with the Quail! So YUMMY! Bo Thai Chan Chanh similar  to a carpaccio! Pho Thai, Bun Thit Nuong and Bahn Xeo!!

Got the cold cuts and grilled beef roll bahn mi's. I was most excited about the second one. Although I've had beef rolls and bahn mi before, never had them together. What a time to be alive. These bahn mi's were just ok. The biggest issue was the bread which wasn't the freshest and was disproportionately larger compared to the amount of meat which was actually just the right amount. In contrast, the veggies were skimped on and much less than what I'm used to especially in comparison to the amount of meat and bread. One saving grace was the homemade chili oil sauce which was hot even by "hot head" standards. Would be willing to try this place again just for that oil (shout out to Mikey Chen). Bahn mi: 3, Chili oil: 5.

Hands down the best Pho you'll find in Las Vegas. I come here at least once a week and they always know my order. They run an amazing business and the food is incredible. Every time I have friends in town I bring them here and they love it. The service is great and the prices are even better.

I can't believe the service. So kind, patient and reasonable. The food is even better or just as good as the people. I come back time and time again and although it may be slow on busy days, their attitude and kindness blows me away enough that i dont mind being patient myself :) always returning!

Horrible service.  We ended up leaving because we waited 10 minutes for the server to come to our table to take a drink order.  There was one server in the entire restaurant.   I tried this Pho restaurant because it had 4 star reviews in Yelp and I'm so disappointed that I wasted my time.

First time eating Vietnamese.  I ordered the Pho; I am hooked!  Amazing food at a great price.  5 people cost us $50.  If your visiting LV and want some authentic food without breaking the bank this is the place to go.

This place has saved my life a few times and a few trips to Spring Mountain. I usually pack my lunch when I have to be at UNLV across the street but 75% of the time, I eat my lunch right after breakfast...on the way to school.

By the time I get out of class, my stomach has already eaten itself. I need to eat constantly. The food comes out quick and I never to have to wait to be seated. Lots of parking.

I normally get the same items: egg rolls, Thai tea and a bowl of pho. The egg rolls are warm and crunchy, and the filling is tasty. The pho is always steaming hot...the broth is good.

Service has always been the greatest out of the Vietnamese restaurants I've been to in town. I always come here solo and I like joking around with the staff here. They're nice like that.
Small restaurant. Bun Bo hue is decent .. Only issue was NO AC .. It was 100 degree outside.

Sandwiches!!

Dude, this is my favorite banh mi place evoooooore! It's really inexpensive and the ingredients are super fresh.  The bread is freshly made, and they have a ton of selections. I really like the chinese egg and sausage banh mi and the charbroiled pork one. MMMM! The sandwiches are about $3-$4, so it's handy for broke college students like myself (also located across the street-ish from the Trop garage of UNLV). I've had pho from here too, and it was pretty decent, but I usually just go for banh mi.  The soup was just cause I was sick that day and had to study haha. Still tasty nonetheless. 

Downsides: This place smells like smoke! gaaah, horrible.  I recommend taking your food to go, unless you like the taste/smell of carcinogens with your food.  Also, the service when you're seated is kinda slow.  I drink a ton of water and the refills didn't come quick enough after I loaded my sandwich with Sriracha.  Plus, they don't really have consistent waiters or whatever.  It's like everyone is doing everthing? I'm not sure. Personally, that's not really a big deal for me since I feel like most authentic Asian restaurants have that same kind of attitude, but sometimes people wanna be dined for real so be cautious 0.0 

Overall, I'd definitely come back...and back...and back again.  It's tasty, low cost, and it's right by school, which is the biggest seller for me.  It's something different from Chipotle or whatever is around campus.
Grilled pork sandwich is the best, it is only $3.50.  Pho is great.  But is that price is higher than most places???

This is my go to Pho place if I am not interested in going to Spring Mountain.  They have some big plusses.  
1.  Pho, Bahn Mi, and Bun all in the same restaurant.
2.  Free Wi-Fi
3.  The ladies here are really helpful and put up with our strange requests.  (One son likes Bahn Mi made from Kalbi, another likes the egg and sausage Bahn Mi with no veggies or Jalapenos, stuff like that)

Downside, when the ladies aren't in town/the restaurant, the service can be less than praiseworthy. 

We've been coming here for 4 years now and it is one of our favorite pho/bun places.

I've only recently made the switch to vegetarianism, so this is only my second pho sans meat, and only one other experience to compare it to.

The vegetable to noodle ratio was off -- too much vegetable, not enough noodle. To be fair, my wife (a vegetarian) thought her pho was great. *shrugs*

My Viet Coffee also had more ice than there was liquid in the cup (as in, the ice had a good half-inch of not being submerged in liquid).

Minor complaints, but I will be glad to get to my regular pho experiences back in Los Angeles.

One day we stopped in and ordered a couple of sandwiches and picked up some spring rolls.  It was our first time and we didn't know what to expect.  It turned out to be a good choice.  

Since then, we have been back a few more times, even had a sit down and ordered the pho, of course I choose by looking at the pictures and the eye appeal helps me make up my mind, but only once did they suggest that it might be too spicy for me, but once it came out, I loved it!

The crispy bread, the thin strips of meat (pork in my case) and the cilantro and jalapenos make the sandwich!   This a quick in and out with pork sandwich good flavors, but this time our spring rolls were bland without taste, if it weren't for the peanut sauce, it would have been an absolute bland roll.
I'm not a big fan of Pho, but this restaurant turned me around. The broth is clean, light and flavorful;  I ate the entire bowl!! We also shared a grilled pork sandwich which was equally tasty.
Great bowl of pho, very flavorful!  I had the vegetable pho, lots of crunchy veggies and tasty broth.  My son had the cold noodles dish with chicken and shrimp and said it was delicious.

I've been here multiple times and I always always get the grilled pork sandwich and it never disappoints. The bread is freshly made and the amount of meat filling to veggies is just right and they never short me on the meat! I haven't tried anything else on the menu but this sandwich is a must order.

If I am craving pho and I am on campus, this is my go-to pho place! Their pho's broth is very flavorful, and their meat is definitely fresh! It is a good portion size for the price I pay! I also really like their water! In addition, if you are looking for a cheap lunch, their sandwiches are really good as well! I like their BBQ pork sandwich because it is really flavorful. If you are down for Viet food, come through to Pho Thanh Huong!

Met a couple of friends there on Saturday, the food was ok.  The real problem was, the restaurant was very hot & stuffy inside.  My friend asked if the AC was turned on, if it was could they lower the temperature?  The waiter, who was very nice said, he did speak to his manager and she will not lower the temperature of the AC.  A short while later we paid for our checked, walked outside...Did you know it was cooler outside of the restaurant then inside, in the month of August in Vegas...That should tell you how hot it was in that restaurant.  
To summarize: Food, just ok.  Restaurant: very hot inside.  Winter months would be a better time to visit Pho Thanh Huong!

We always have good food when we go here. The staff is nice, the food is tasty, the portions are large but it's still a good bet. I don't give five stars to any place really, so from me is pretty good.

Came in this past Saturday evening with a friend who happens to work at the 2HIGUYS vape shop a couple doors down (plug-in). Lol. Anyway, we weren't greeted immediately and being my first time...Wasn't sure if we had to seat ourselves or they seat us. Apparently, you seat yourselves. 

Once we assessed which table we were going to rest our elbows on because gosh knows when there are madd tables (I typed, madd. Dang...do people still use the term?) open...the first world problems kick in.

The restaurant is pretty spacious--clean too. Staff were friendly and pretty prompt.

Onward...Never been but knew I wanted a banh mi. So I opted for their grilled pork banh mi sans the jalapenos por favor. I even said please! My sandwich caMe with jalapenos. No biggie, nothing my fingers can't pick out. Bread was toasted wonderfully, meat was full of flavor, and it certainly filled the inside of that baguette wonderfully. I was bummed though because I swear I only seen cucumbers in there. If there were the usual pickled veggies...they were scarce. Scarce like there was a radish and carrot drought. Scarce like Bugs Bunny cultivated the crap out of them carrot fields. Scarce like somebody plucked all the carrots in the world to make some juice because homeboy was trying to improve his eyesight. And then the radish fields....uhh..ummm...must've been a bad crop month or something. Lol.

I'm not a pho person so didn't have that. Overall, it wasn't all that bad. I'm still a kinh do banh mi lover. Felt the prices were typical of other vietnamese locations. 

I say...if you are in the vicinity, want a different view from your usual, don't have a preferred vietnamese spot, and this is the fare you are craving...well go get 'um tiger. If you are a UNLV student, perfect! If not, Chinatown is about 10mins away if you can hold your stomach in. Despite the disappointment in veggie ratio...the meat made up for it so it certainly hit the spot. 

Ample parking, definitely stroller and kid friendly, and based on my friend's opinion...he lerrrves their tofu spring roll. So for you vegeterians or tofu lovers, just may wanna try that out.

Enjoy!
Some of the best pho I've ever head. Brisket was quality beef. Best pork egg rolls I've ever had.

We always go to this restaurant whenever we are in Vegas. The food is cheap and authentic. The sandwiches are exceptional and the pho noodles are delicious.

On this visit, the service had somehow declined. Our server was busy tending to a little girl and watching football on tv. The bean sprouts were beginning to brown, with long brown tails still attached to them. The basil leaves were wilted with many brown spots on them. Apparently, the owners figured nobody would notice?

This was another good pho place to go to. It was kind of awkward when we first walked in because the guy kind of just acknowledge us from across the room and told us to just find a seat anywhere. 

I am really in search of a good pho restaurant that will consistently satisfy my taste buds when i am craving it and this place is good. The prices are good and the serving size was good for the price too. There  banh mi was good too. 

Its easy to miss the place if you are not familiar with the area. But its worth a sit down. I say pho saigon 8 is first on my love it list but this place is good too!

They have the best grilled pork banh mi in Vegas by far. The pork is super delicious, the bread is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, pickled veggies are on point, and it's priced very well at around 4 dollars. Their egg rolls are also pretty damn good and only about a buck each. BEST BANH MI IN TOWN!

I was not feeling well and really wanted some good soup. I got off work and was able to call in an order and pick it up on my way back to my hotel. The portions were great and the broth was not over salted. The customer service was great. I would go there again if I'm ever back to Vegas.

Ok more like 3.5 stars. 

I try to be as impartial as possible when trying a new place, but I'm not quite sure what's going on with this place. We arrived around 12:30pm and expected a lunch rush. The place was mostly empty, maybe 6 tables out of 17 had customers dining. With two other parties in front of us, we were told we had to put our names on a list and wait to be seated. It only took 5 minutes to be seated, but given that so many tables were empty, waiting at all seemed odd. 

The hostess is very friendly and delivered menus and took our order quickly. We ordered pho and a bahn mi sandwich and were given the usual plate of condiments to go with it, but it was missing the Thai basil and cilantro. When we asked about it, the server said they recently started omitting these items from the plate and only served them if customers asked. So that is a little weird to me too. 

My dining companion was served her soup several minutes before my sandwich came out, which is also when the iced coffee I had ordered at the start came out. Also weird. 

But as for the food, the bahn mi sandwich rolls are HUGE. Like...American football sized. And they are GOOD! They were a little skimpy on the jalapeños, but I understand not everyone has a mouth made of asbestos like mine. 

All in all worth it for the food, but the service is just a little weird, which is the only reason for the 3 stars.

It took us a while to find this place but man was it worth it when we found it.  Their broken rice was spectacular.  I had the broken rice with pork steak, Vietnamese sausage, and tofu wrap shrimp cake.  The sausage was average but everything else was delicious; the pork steak and tofu wrap shrimp cake were the best I've had at any Vietnamese restaurant.  I'll be back next time...and bringing even more friends.  Check this place out when you're free, it's better than a lot of the crap they call food on the strip.  It's cheap price and yet delectable at the same time.

Two thumbs up!!!!

Pho (soup) and their Banh Minhs (sandwiches) are to die for!!! Not to mention their Chinese Food choices!!!! This place is a hole in the wall but their food choices are awesome!!!

Located 5 miles from the airport, no traffic, parking is not a problem either!!!!

The staff are courteous and gets your order right!!!

This was the original banh mi spot in Las Vegas...however, seems like they switched owners recently, but I could be wrong.  The menu has changed a bit, but not by much.  This is the only place I know that has lupcheong banh mi sandwiches, in addition to other flavors.  Its hard to go wrong with banh mi sandwiches, but I am not a fan of dry french bread that saws the palette of your mouth. Yikes.  Still, I gotta go with the old trusty grilled pork or chicken with pate.  I could do with a little more pickled shredded daikon with carrots, but it never seems to be enough.  All in all, this place is cheap and can hit the spot.  Close to the UNLV area and seem to catch the youngsters in there along with the general masses.  That goes to show that this place still maintains its clientele well.

Happened to be on the east side and in need of a quick lunch,  so I though I would try this place out.  

I ordered the pho with beef.  It was pretty, pretty, pretty good.  The broth did have the umami type element that we all enjoy.  The condiments were fresh.

The service was suspect. Not because the employees don't speak english, but just bad service.  I walk in and it has a counter like a quick service restaurant so I stood at the counter for 5 minutes.  So I finally asked the woman working behind the counter - "how can I get some food?" then she pointed to the tables.

Someone finally took my order after I sat down.  I got the food fast which was good.  So I ate - I waited for ever to get a bill...  I finally walk up to the counter I said " I would like to pay now."   She was very confused.

So the food was - good - the service was weird - I just don't know why people own restaurants with out any people skills!

I have been to this place 1-2 times per month over the past six years. The sandwiches are very good and the price is good. 

Tl:dr good sandwiches, good price, long wait times without telling you if they are busy. Details below. 

Unfortunately I won't be heading back anytime soon due to the sub par service I received as well as the attitude. 

My mom was in town and wanted something quick so I suggested this place as we can order to go and it would be no problem. 

Ordered 9 sandwiches. I saw tables that sat after I ordered being served sandwiches after I placed my order. After 20 minutes of waiting I asked for the status and the counter girl said it would be an additional 15 bc the back was busy. In the end it ended up taking 50 minutes and they shorted me one sandwich. They also did every single sandwich incorrectly from what ordered. At the end I told the girl next time if she could let a person know an order was going to take longer than half an hour in the beginning it would be better and her response was to call in the order next time. I always tip on a to go order and at that point I asked for the tip back which i regret doing as the other staff deserved it. 

Wish them the best of luck and sorry that my regular counter girl wasn't there today.

Decent com (rice) dishes including their noodle soups (bun bo hue & pho). Digging their banh hoi with the grilled beef wrapped shrimps, it's a thinly square rice noodle (thinner than vermicelli). The bomb!  The plate was full of veggies/herbs. The com is plateful and very fresh & good. Pho is pho. bun bo hue is pretty clean cut here in vegas.  I believe that pho Saigon 8 have the best bun bo so far.  Banh mi is not supreme, but it's pretty crunchy & good to eat also.  Friendly servicers and the foods comes out pretty fast. The durian & avocado smoothies are serve here, love those smoothies.  A bit water down tho,  but still heavenly good.  Will be back whenever I'm around the area for sure.

If you come from LA or anywhere else that has thousands of pho restaurants, forget about this one. Too salty. Never order the seafood. You don't want to be surprised by the smelly crab. Services are four stars, food one star.

This place will probably be my go to pho place whenever I'm in Vegas now. The location is convenient and pho is delicious.

Oh! I tried their banh mi thit as other reviewers suggested and it was awesome! The bread was perfectly crunchy, the jalapenos were a tad too spicy and I would have preferred a bit more pate, but the overall result was fab!

The service was friendly and prompt, we recieved our orders no less than 10 minutes after it was put in. Awesome.
I've only been here a few times and I always get the #56 sandwich. It's very tasty and fresh. For $3.25 it's a great lunch. Some day I'll be adventurous and try the pho dishes.

My first time trying this food outside of Vegas strip. All the way from LA to Vegas for this food what can I say? I'm a picky person when that's comes to Vietnamese food why? Probably because I'm a Vietnamese person as well and know my food? Lol.
Anyways the food was really good I will defiantly go back here next time I'm coming back to Vegas!
Great service. The food is excellent and the shakes phenomenal. Great place for date night. You get your food fast and has a great atmosphere.

The best pho place with the best prices and the best staff and experience! I recommend the Pho Chay with vegetables and tofu but sub the tofu with chicken. For $3 extra you can make it extra large portion. The baked chicken sandwich is also great. The best place ever, in fact among all cuisines. I love it that much.

For a pho restaurant it is on point.  The restaurant serve other authentic Vietnamese soups and dishes.  I had Bun Bo Hue soup.  It was decent but nothing outstanding.  The garnish that came with it - cabbage was very bitter.  I believed they may have prepared it too early.  We also ordered Bo Luc Lac (shaken beef steak with rice). This dish was very good.  Pho Bo Vien (pho meat balls) was good.  Yes, I would return.

This is the BEST place for Vietnamese sandwiches. I even think it might be in the overall top best sandwich shops in lv. My family's been going here for years and all those guys are fat so I have some credibility. If you don't think so try for yourself. They bake the bread in house and it is like sex biting into the crisp then supple roll, they grill the pork to tender perfection and is marinated with mouth watering smoky sweet goodness. Ask for less or no jalapeño if you aren't a spicy fanatic, but I recommend training yourself to be CUZ THESE GUYS DO SPICY RIGHT!!! Every time go to this place the sandwiches and service are always awesome and my experience always definitely exceeds my expectation.
This place deserves 0 and the health inspector needs to take a look!!!! A roach was in the soup I was feeding to my daughter!!!! Absolutely disgusting!!!!!! Never coming here again!

I went there for the first time last night. We ordered it for pick up. When we got there the place was very clean and nice. We agreed next time to sit down because it was so clean and nice. On our drive home the food smelled amazing. I ordered the chicken Pho and it was even more amazing than it smelled. My top 2 for sure!! (Pho Kim Long). And the Grilled chicken was what my fiancé ordered and that was good too!

We are actually going back today.. I want more Pho :)

The pho here is pretty good, but has a lot of MSG in it because I was really thirsty after eating it. We also got the bbq pork banh mi and that was tasty, would recommend ordering.

Overall decent spot for pho and banh mi in Vegas, prices are on the higher side compared to OC, which is expected.

This is my first time here but not my Last because as a big and I'm always looking for places that I can have something healthy that I really enjoy eating.

  I absolutely love the veggie spring rolls and the veggie and tofu pho along with the fresh Phillipino Coconut.

My friends are telling me all about traditional Filipino dishes and I'm looking forward to visiting the Philippines and having them there too.

According to my friends this is a very traditional Filipino restaurant and food and it's absolutely fabulous!!!

This place has good pho and very good and inexpensive sandwiches. Their seafood pho is a little pricey compared to other pho places. I think it's expensive because they put an actual crab (one piece) rather than artificial crab (which is multiple at other places) but it's good. If you check in and mention yelp you get one free yelp review. The sandwich is perfect size with good portion inside and very inexpensive. It's nearby UNLV so I'll be coming back whenever I'm on campus or nearby :)
I ordered the tofu noodle salad and it was delicious. The atmosphere was clean and the cashier was very helpful in helping me decide what to order. I will be going back!

I love the sandwiches here!

I always get the pork. Wish they had beef, but pork's pretty awesome, too.
Did not have the sandwiches. However, my party ordered a few Phos and some rice plates. All came out well. The grilled pork and baked eggs were especially tasty.

The gfs and I came here for lunch on a Friday. Overall, we were happy with our food. Decently priced, normal portions, and fast service.

The only con is that there's a stale lingering smell of cigarettes in the air, which I couldn't get used to.

No beuno!

After the chilly walk thru the Ethel M Gardens and Christmas lights, my friend and I decided we needed a little heat, so we were off to look for Pho. A quick yelp search brought this place up so we headed over.

Located in the shopping center with Vons or Smiths grocery (not sure which) on the SW corner of Maryland Pkwy and Tropicana. Very nice restaurant, clean, and with plenty of seating. They were playing the football game on TV so +1 for me. 

Ordered the pork chop and a bowl of Pho Tai Chin. Food came out quickly and was decent, the pork chop was kind of small but flavorful. The Pho was very tasty, with plenty of meat to go with the broth. I always taste the broth before adding anything, and this had a nice flavor. A little squeeze of lime and a few bean sprouts and its all warm in my belly.

Its not fancy, but its good. Its not expensive, but its good. Will definitely be back because its easier to get here than to the places on Eastern. Family owned and operated.

Given that I work at the school, I come here pretty often. The food is always good, consistent, and the servers are quick and friendly.

I don't think I've ever had anything less than delicious here - which is why I keep coming back!

ok... i only wanted banh mi when i came here... but everything else looked SOOO GOOD on the menu.... but it WASNT. i didnt try the pho, but maybe i should have.... 

I got the bun mam, which is like a thick rice spagetti type noodle with fish, shrimp and pork... and it was SALTY AS HELL. omg i almost died trying to finish all the noodle and meat. NEVER AGAIN.

My bf got something else....(dont remember what it was) and he didnt like it very much either....


i finished eating and in the beginning of the meal i ordered a Banh Mi Cha Lua to go (Pork Loaf Sandwich w/ Pate) and the sandwich alone restored my faith in this place!!!!!!!!


BANH MI HERE IS THE BEST IN VEGAS!!!!
THE PATE HAS A REALLLY GOOOD BLACK PEPPER FLAVOR AND I WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK OFTEN FOR THIS SANDWICH!!!

It was really too hot in Las Vegas for pho, but pho is a damn good hangover cure and it was, after all, the Saturday after a REALLY good night.

The service was really good and all the food came out very quick. They had fresh coconut which was a treat in 100 degree weather. Prices were also very fair considering the amount of food... We really could've done 2 people to a bowl but our cognitive powers were not at their best at the time. Great off-strip option without being too far away.

My fiance and I were in Vegas for a short vacay and were craving Vietnamese food.  We found this place through Yelp and decided to give it a try based on their solid reviews.  They are located across from UNLV and there was a ton of parking in their lot.  I thoroughly enjoyed their pho and really liked the consistency of the noodles which were chewier than what I'm used to.  The portion was very generous and there was also a lot of meat in the pho which many other establishments skimp on.  My fiance had their egg and sausage banh mi and loved it.  He said their bread was just like the ones he's had in Vietnam.  We also had their iced coffee which was excellent also.  I highly recommend this place for reasonably priced Vietnamese food that is fresh and tasty.

Pho Thanh Huong has became my favorite Vietnamese restaurant for pho and sandwiches. Also, the prices are decent and the food is tasty. I can't imagine going anywhere else to get my Vietnamese food fix.

Ok, so we were a large group of black people but we like our pho. Service was ok, extremely slow, and she forgot a few items. We had to keep waving over the hostess who would then go into the kitchen to get our waitress.

After a long night of clubbing and drinking, pho is the best remedy for a hang over. I've tried a handful pho places whenever I'm in Vegas, but I have to say this is by far one of my favorite places to eat at. I like how they allow you to build your own pho, in which you could choose whatever toppings you like. For my pho I just kept it simple so I chose rare steak and meat balls. The portion is pretty big, I couldn't even finish my bowl of pho, but for the price of 10 dollars, it's pretty much equivalent to 2 pho bowls in OC. I also ordered a side of eggrolls to go with my pho. The size is quite small nothing too special about them, just typical eggrolls and fish sauce. I've had bigger ones back home in California. They also sell banh mi too! Unfortunately I was too full to try them, I should have bought some for the road. I will most definitely stop by next time for the sandwiches!
Great amazing food!!!! So much so that even when the service is slow I keep coming back. The servers are friendly but just slow.

Banh mi (Vietnamese subs) are not the norm around my side of town, but since this is near school and doesn't require a detour from my normal routes, It hits the spot. 

Was craving a BBQ Pork sandwich, loaded with vegetables including cucumbers, carrots and the white one (which is so honestly called "white carrot" when translated my way) and Cilantro! 

Delicious, friendly staff and the bread comes out warm (possibly due to heating in a conventional oven before the goodies are inserted) but still nonetheless satisfying. I prefer this style of banh mi versus the Lee's baguettes or any baguettes for that matter since they're much tougher and tend to shred the top of my mouth. 

Definitely recommended, but will have to try other dishes when I am inclined to do so. :)
Awesome pho, vermicelli bowl (spicy pork and shrimp), and bomb banh mi. Service was great as well and waters were filled quickly. Would not recommend the spring rolls.

The portions were more than generous, and the menu is vegetarian friendly.

Also, the waitress was so kind and attentive. The Vietnamese coffee is just what I needed for the night's study haul. In total, a bowl of vegetarian pho (pho chay) and 2 iced coffees came out to $15. Glad that it's so close to UNLV, will be visiting again when my wallet allows it.

They remodeled, wow, apparently 9 months ago?

Banh mi is now $3.25 each, $3.50 total with tax. So hungry after studying at Lied, I inhaled my BBQ pork banh mi; so delicious with crispy bread, warm meat, sweet mayo, pickled veggies, and just a hint of heat from jalapeños....I bought the egg and Chinese sausage one ($3.50 +tax) for my roommate but can smell it in my bag, so it might not last the rest of my study session....haha, glad to have a reason to come back to this place, and I'll be back again!!

I was searching for PHO on this hot day lol and based on the reviews so I decided to give it a try. The restaurant is very clean and tidy. I ordered the spring rolls and a bowl of rare steak pho. My order took a while, at least the pho did. The rolls came out within 5-10 minutes. I was half way through and I heard the microwave being used and I thought why? Lol so probably 5 minutes later my big bowl of soup was served. The steak was a bright red which appears to be fresh, good sign. I add all the side items to it and taste the broth and the flavor was ok, not bad. However it lacked a lot of seasoning. Being that I've lived by naval military bases which are located in a heavily populated Asian community I consider my opinion or rather my palette on the experienced side when it comes to PHO lol just saying lol So anyways, I was disappointed that my broth wasn't like fresher since it cooled down pretty quickly and that took away from the dining experiences with pho. Your mouth experiences heat, flavorful broth, seasoning like Anise, etc and some decent tasting beef. I unfortunately didn't experience that today. It was OK but not the best I've had in a while. Server was accommodating

I used to frequent this place on occasion because of the location and they offered semi decent food. 

However, a couple weeks ago I had one of the worse experiences of my life. I had walked in literally a minute before closing, so they were not the most friendly. However, they still had a restaurant full and if they didn't want anyone to come in, they should have locked the doors. (which they did after I walked in)

I ordered special combo Pho with extra tendon to go along with a grilled pork banh mi. The wait was short and easy. I paid for my food and was on my way home.

Me and my hunny shared the banh mi, which was half ass put together. I had a piece of cucumber which was literally 1/3 of a cucumber that was just thrown on there. And not to mention almost a whole jalapeno that was just on one side of the sandwich. Talk about lazy and no attention to detail. 

So after we finish the banh mi, I pour my broth in a pot to warm it up and get it steaming hot so my meat can warm up too. When I go to open the container up, the first thing I look at is my tendon and considering I paid almost $2.00 for extra tendon, I felt ripped off. My rare meat, not even cooked had a light brown tinge to it, which means it was not fresh. 

And then to make things worse, two little flies or gnats or whatever they were flew out of the bay leaf and bean sprout pile and completely ruined my appetite.

In utter disgust, I threw it all away and almost felt the need to vomit.

I used to like this place. But now, you will never ever catch me here, no matter how bad I got a craving for Pho or  banh mi.

Great Vietnamese food, so far there hasn't been anything bad about this place. While hanging out at the Hard Rock, we got hungry and got a friend to bring some food from this place. Sandwiches (banh mi), house special soup (pho dac biet), Hue style soup (Bun bo Hue), and fried rolls (cha gio) were all delicious. When you get a chance or you need a hangover cure, give his place a shot. The service is polite and accommodating.
Awesome sandwich! Also had an asparagus crab soup. It was alright. Cornstarch based soups aren't something I normally seek out. But food was legit. I'd come back if I was in the area.

This is my usual dine spot for Vietnamese food whenever I'm in town. Their food is very delicious and authentic. I don't know if it's because one of the owners reminds me of my mom or not, but the place is a good mom and pop shop unlike the ones on Spring Mountain Road with their fancy ambiance.
I come here for items other than pho. Their bun rieu oc and bun bo hue is very good! Sadly, I haven't tried their sandwiches yet, but i will soon.
Prices are also reasonable. Their usual diners are students from UNLV since it is located in University Village. 
Service is great and your food comes out in a flash like most Vietnamese places. One of my favorite things about dining at Vietnamese restaurants is their "pay at the counter" policy. No need to wait around for the server to pick up your tab or split the bill 10 ways.

Great broth on pho, shrimp rolls are good but sauce was bland. I also ordered the egg rolls but when I took a bite I found a white string inside and lost my appetite. This place used to be my favorite, the owners are wonderful and nice. I remember when they first opened I come often and service was outstanding.

On the hunt to get to more of my bookmarks during my lunch hour, I decided to give Pho Thanh Huong another shot. I came here years ago before I was on Yelp and thought they were good, but only if I happened to be in the neighborhood while craving Vietnamese.. They had pretty good sandwiches, but I just didn't end up back here again until today. 

I ordered a grilled beef banh mi and Thai tea with boba. The sandwiches looked a lot different than I remembered them. The French bread they use is enormous and much bigger than on my previous visit. The meat they used was a little different than I'm used to in banh mi. It was a little smokier than I like but very moist. It was a little on the messy side. They packed it to go in a way that was difficult to eat without dripping meat juice all over myself while I ate. The pickled veggies were hidden under the meat which made them a little soggier and less crunchy. I'll have to ask them to put the veggies on top next time so they stay fresh and don't drown in meat juice. The bread was really great. A little breadier than I'm used to, more like a bolillo shape than French bread but very flaky and light. The Thai tea with boba was good. A little on the sweeter side, but still good. 

The price is right, so I'll definitely give them another chance if I find myself in the area again. I was perusing the menu and their pho and other hot menu items seemed to run on the more expensive side compared to other pho restaurants I frequent. I think this is a good place to grab a cheap sandwich on the go.
I've been coming here since they opened.... Always fresh!  Sometimes I buy bread rolls just to take home..... Very good #32 is my "Go-To" dish in the Summer - Pho in the Winter

Are you on campus and don't want to go through the hassle of getting on any ramps on any freeways and want some Vietnamese food or pho? If you don't mind getting inside your whip and driving around the corner of Tropicana and Maryland, you will find that Pho Thanh Huong is the place for you. 

The food here is decent and the flavor of the pho that I ordered tasted good. Standard regular and large sizes. The value is decent for what you get.

Service does their job and refills drinks. 

Located in the plaza with Vons and PT's. There is plenty of parking.

The food here is delicious. Pho tai is not on the menu but they serve it. I used to frequent this place but Recently had to stop eating here- every time myself or a family member got sick. Super bummer :(

I was very satisfied with menu item number 1.  My Cambodian friends really liked some of the other items. Its a very traditional place and big break from the obnoxious other restaurants in Vegas. The bread and sandwiches are excellent and healthy!
